title: Loved it
text: Great ambience, tremendous service by every single member of the ample staff, and very good restaurant. The room was small but very stylish and functional; quite happy with it. I chose this property due to longtime previous experience with the Renaissance brand, and because it was an event in Chelsea that took my to NYC; not only did it not disappoint, but I loved it and would happily stay there again.

title: not worth the price
text:
Cons: 1/Rooms are really small and dark with little sunlight 2/TV had glitches 3/Did not deliver utensils to room after confirming that they will. 3/Baggage handler is running his own taxi hustle and interfered with our Uber ride 4/Rooftop bar is usually closed to hotel guests but the hotel website makes you believe that it is available.

Pros: Close to subway stops, but that is probably true for all hotels in Manhattan.

title: Great Nee York Stay
text: Great location. The ambience is incredible and the customer service is amazing. From my room, I even had a view of the Statue of Liberty. Wonderful hotel if you are traveling as a family. Lots of food options and shopping options in walking distance. Great adjacency to 5th Ave

title: Exceptional Hosts
text:
We have been staying at the Renaissance Chelsea since it opened 4 years ago. The former management team was lovely and now we are fortunate to have Paul, Phoenix and others as our gracious hosts whenever in NYC. We are Marriott Bonvoy Platinum Elite Lifetime Members and are always treated the the utmost care and kindness. I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else! 
We highly recommend staying at the Renaissance Chelsea!

title: Our new favorite NYC hotel
text:
Fantastic stay with 2 rooms at this location.  
Great check in experience, two modern/clean rooms on a low floor , accommodating staff, and a cute lobby bar.  Gym is small but has everything you need to get in a workout.

Location is also great.  Less than ten minutes minute walk from the 7th Ave side of Penn Station.   Lots of parking lots near by as well. 

We had the full breakfast Buffett and it was above average for a Marriott Buffett and the staff (including Charlie) was gracious and accommodating.  

We concur with the other reviews about getting a lower floor (at least on the weekends) due to the roof top club.  We overheard several folks who were staying  on the 34th floor who said they heard the music until 4am 

Overall great experience and we will be back !

title: Poor customer service from staff.
text: Our room had a great view and was clean and comfortable. Bathroom shower head did not work properly. Overall my experience was average due to the staff. My friends and I were waiting in the lobby for an Uber late night and was basically harassed by the lobby security. Instead of asking what room I was staying in they they assumed we were attending the onsite club, and were threatening to kick us out for hanging in the lobby. Also at check in I was asked if I wanted a late check out at 1pm, and said yes, and then received a call from the front desk asking why we did not check out at 12pm. I think that hotel management needs to reevaluate their customer service standards. I would not stay here again due to this experience.

title: Chic in Midtown
text: We stayed here for six nights. Perfect location in Midtown Manhattan and about a 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Steps away from restaurants, cafés, and a supermarket. As with other Renaissance hotels, the atmosphere is upbeat and chic. If you’re an elite member expecting a full breakfast, you may want to make other plans. They do offer a continental breakfast, with limited items. I was offered a room towards the top floor, however, I was advised by hotel staff there could be noise from the nightclub. I decided to take a room on one of the lower floors. Beautiful property. Highly recommended if you’re considering.

title: Ideal location for what we needed.
text: This hotel embraces the Renaissance Discoverer vibe that we look for.  The hotel staff is attentive and friendly.  The hotel facility is clean.  Our room was the standard sized room, but we were on a corner that allowed for great views of the Empire State and the river.  The breakfast was standard fair, the service made the morning. A coffee bar in the lobby with pastries for a grab and go opportunity. Located in Chelsea and 2 blocks from the F line trains we were able to get about rather easily.  It is a 30 block walk to Midtown and the Theatre district,  The area had a good vibe, we went to an outdoor flea market, there is a supermarket across the street and 2 Bros Pizza for that late night fix.  We will stay here again on a return to NYC.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I stayed here in July 2021 when the hotel first opened, and stayed again this past weekend. I really like this hotel. The front desk staff, especially Jessica, is always friendly and welcoming. I really like the cool hanging chairs in the lobby. I had a quesadilla at the restaurant and enjoyed it. I had a corner room on the 32nd floor with an excellent view of Midtown. I love the design of this hotel - very artistic/floral among many aspects. Also the location is great.

title: Hip and Comfortable in Chelsea
text: We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel in Chelsea for two nights in early December to celebrate our anniversary. The location is great, close to subways, near many restaurants and perfect for seeing the city's sites both uptown and downtown. We were able to check in early - thanks Renaissance! - and welcomed by a very friendly and courteous front desk staff. Our room was NY-style cosy with a vibe that's both comfortable and hip. Bedding is perfect for a good night's sleep. The breakfast buffet is serviceable, complete and convenient - attended to by a friendly staff (cappuccino anyone?). Our checkout time was extended which was greatly appreciated. An excellent way to extend a very nice stay in the big Apple!

title: Extraordinary service & beautiful room!
text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left,  we felt warmly welcomed and taken care of!  What great friendly and service minded staff!  Shout out to Phoenix in the reception for exceptional hospitality!!!

title: Xmas at the R
text: The hotel seemed bigger on  pictures but it was okay. Comfy bed, friendly front desk staff! We also dined at their restaurant. Food was good and we loved that there was live entertainment at the lobby at Night. They sang classic Christmas songs. My daughter loved the complimentary hot cocoa :) we will come back.

title: Tiny rooms, poor service, good location
text:
Tried this new renaissance property in the West 20s near Chelsea and the flower district.  The hotel is only about 2 years old.  However, a decent King room was barely bigger than the bed!  Rooms are TINY. Beware.  And for the rates we paid (one night was over $600), it was NOT worth it at all. The service quality was poor at best - for example, multiple calls to front desk, housekeeping and restaurant went unanswered; staff were kind of curt; as a lifetime elite member, I did not feel
Like I was valued at all. No upgraded room even offered.  Towels were flimsy. Toiletries are the mass toiletries bolted to the wall. Room decor was ok, but the room was so small it didn’t help much. The safe was half the size of a normal one - laptops had no chance of fitting.  WiFi was choppy at times.  Location was convenient. But I would not stay here again.  There are larger rooms with better value and service at other properties.

title: A déconseiller pas sérieux
text:
Attention publicité mensongère 
Lit double très petit 
Chambre très petite mal située
L’hôtel ne répond jamais!
Et la possibilité d’aller sur le toit toujours fermé !
Pas de piscine
Ne pas passer par Booking qui de s’engage …. De toutes responsabilités….. et personne ne réponds ! A déconseiller 
Très cher

title: Not terrible, but I won't stay again
text: The location of this hotel is great. It's very central to subway stops and a part of NYC I had not spent much time in before now. The room was much smaller than I remember NYC hotels being but that's probably more on me than them. I didn't have any issues with loud music from the nightclub, although I did hear some "adult playtime" through the vents. I had issues with housekeeping which forgot to clean my room and when I came back I was in quite a hurry to make my evening plans. I tried using the mobile app chat for requests but they were ignored at first. And when I had food delivered and someone at the front desk told me they would have it brought up, they must have forgotten and I had to follow up 20 minutes later. I think the service and attention to detail could be much better. I love Marriott hotels and the Renaissance brand but I don't think I'll stay at this one again.

title: Dirty, Gross, Disgusting
text: After a long day of travel I decided I go up to my room for an afternoon nap. Just as I was about to slip into bed I stopped in shock of what I had just seen. As I lifted the cover the afternoon sunlight was peeking in and showing all the dirt, mold and whatever else was on the duvet. I immediately called management. The housekeeping managers response to what he saw was simply appalling. He stated “the discoloring is due to overwashing”. Even if that was the case how would one even think a guest would feel comfortable slipping into this bed. The pictures to follow will speak volumes. If you are looking for one of the grungiest hotels in NYC this is your spot. Gross, gross, gross!!!

title: Bonvoy’s Worst Experience Ever
text:
Worst experience I ever had in NYC. My holiday has been ruined by this unfriendly cheap overpriced hotel. I didn’t feel like staying in a Bonvoy’s hotel. I was so surprised to see how small the room was with total rates USD 5000 for 10 nights Non-refundable. Overpriced even for New York and this is not my first time to visit NYC.

As Bonvoy member and stayed for 10 night, they allocated us in the worst smallest possible room available in the hotel. Room 2509. Avoid this room !! Very dark, very small with no view. Similar to Ibis style hotel. No bath robe, no slipper, no minibar and very small closet even for 1 person. I attached the photos how they setup the hair drier in the bathroom. 

The breakfast wasn’t included . You have to pay their low quality breakfast USD 38 / person where you get dry pastries and coffee in a paper cup served by unfriendly waiters.

Prior to my arrival, I tried to send them e-mail as I have some requests. They simply didn’t care. When I check-in and asked why was my e-mail wasn’t replied, They were just smiling. No bother giving explanation. The attitude of front desk staffs here shall be urgently fixed. No customer service oriented at all. No greeting, no welcome, nothing. The first thing they asked was my credit card. This hotel seems like having bad management.

They did not replenish the coffee and tea automatically until you ask. HK was placing DND letter as fast as they could, even before 1 pm. The cleaning lady was nice, but was difficult to communicate as she doesn’t speak and understand English at all. Cleaning quality can be improved. I ve attached a photo of alarm clock where full of dust on top.

Shameful to Bonvoy Marriot as Renaissance is one of their premium brand.

title: SCAMMED US OUT OF $350, MONTHS LATER STILL NO ANSWER FROM HOTEL ABOUT CHARGE AND STILL HAVE OUR MONEY. DO NOT STAY.
text: My partner and I stayed in this hotel in August. We had originally booked for July 23rd however had to change the dates. After a week of this hotel refusing to help or even speak to us about this issue, we had to contact booking.com (who thankfully done their job and helped us straight away). Once we got to the hotel we were asked to give our card details again and were assured this was only a precaution so that they had our information on file incase we ran up any room charges. We explained that we had paid for our stay up front when we initially booked, to which the employee on the front desk confirmed. After our stay, we checked our bank statement only to discover they had charged us TWICE. After two months we have emailed and called endlessly and have had no help and no response in either form of communication. They still have our money… DO NOT BOOK, ABSOLUTE SCAM!!!!!!!! Also, horrible location, fairly central but on a dodgy street.

title: Amazing stay!! 💯 recommended!
text:
What an amazing hotel!! Renaissance Chelsea has the perfect location, Emar Fernández and his staff went above and beyond to make my stay spectacular!
I won’t stay anywhere else when I go to NYC but there!
The breakfast was super yummy! The gym had all the machines I needed, the room was so beautiful and had an amazing view and I also loved the shower!! I didn’t want to leave!!

title: The street is full of drug taking homeless people asking for money and injecting and defecating in front of you.
text:
The hotel was lovely but it should be clear the roof bar and pool are not for hotel guests to use. There is also one less elevator in use as the club upstairs has sole access so getting up and down is not straightforward, there is a long wait and it’s packed every time. 

The welcome was cold and staff don’t tell you any info unless you ask. How to work the lift with the card, what time breakfast is, the tax charge and when you pay (I asked and was told I didn’t have to pay anything but I knew I would have to) they took it off my card without asking and then returned it on the last day to then ask me to pay on check out. That was inconvenient as it was my spending money for the trip, a few other things such as the rewards programme or what is Included in your stay. The barman is also never at the bar so hard to get a drink. 

The worst part (which I’m shocked isn’t mentioned in other reviews) is the road the hotel is on is used as a drug meet up where sales are made and homeless people inject themselves in front of you. We also had someone defecate in front of us and there is faeces all over the street. Homeless people ask you for money constantly when you’re at the hotel patio and in the morning before 10am the street looks like the walking dead with drugged up people all over the place. 

It’s a shame as the hotel design is chic and clean and the location is fab. The rooms are small but I expect that for NYC.

title: A great option, in a good location.
text:
I was a little nervous as to whether we'd made a good choice in booking Renaissance Chelsea as reviews ranged, and it wasn't mentioned at all on the Facebook page I was part of prior to our trip. 

I was pleasantly surprised though. Everything was clean, comfortable and had a nice feel. Yes, the room was a little on the small side, with nowhere to really store luggage without blocking the walkway, but the location was excellent and I would certainly consider staying here again. 

Top tip - make use of the guest perks. We visited the Guggenheim museum and spent time on the TopView hop on and off bus - both exceeding expectations. 

Maddison Square Park just along the road adjacent to the flatiron building is a great spot to sit and watch the world go by. 

Walking distance to everywhere - the only subway ride we took was to Brooklyn. 

Niggles - tiny bottles of water that you have to get from reception create lots of plastic waste. Never saw any of the 'snacks' available while we were there.

Hotel doesn't respond to social media - sent enquiry on Facebook and Instagram prior to visit but both remain unread.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent hotel Room was very clean The bed was very comfortable, excellent shower love the rainhead shower. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. We were greeted with cookies when we checked in. Very welcoming and warm feeling. Ideal location Central to everything.

title: Amazing Hospitality Services
text:
Hospitality is extremely important to us and the staff at this hotel go over and beyond to make you feel welcomed. Starting at the top Joe Kelly GM greeted us at the front door with a big smile and a great conversation. Then we had the pleasure to meet Emar Fernandez Assistant GM who was amazing.
Mr. Fernandez went over and beyond like no other manager we ever met with class. He is amazing person.
LeonardoPacheco always smiling was the perfect host (navigator) he was amazing, nothing too big for him to handle). The list goes on Christian (Bellman), Jessica (PM
Manager), Brian (Supervisor), Loren (Supervisor), Ema
(Housekeeper), Mariam (AM
Manager), Phoenix (FrontDesk), (Housekeeper), Mariam (AM
Manager), Phoenix (FrontDesk), Stefan (FrontDesk), Andrea (FrontDesk), Shanna (FrontDesk) and Vinny (Housekeeper) all gave top notch service and hospitality.
Everyone always kept a genuine smile willing to assist you in all your needs. This is a memorable hotel based on excellent service.
First choice for us to stay. Top NYC hotel that strives for excellence.

title: Stellar Stay at the Renaissance!
text: We took a chance booking the Renaissance last minute and it paid off! Phoenix offered AMAZING customer service, from check-in to checkout. We showed up before 4pm checkin and Phoenix let us know he had a room available, however it was on the 35th floor right under the rooftop bar. He was kind enough to let us know that on the weekend we might be able to hear some music, but most people don't find it bothersome. In exchange, he guaranteed we would have an amazing city view. I seriously appreciated Phoenix being upfront with us, and we decided to take the room on the 35th floor. AMAZING views! We barely heard the rooftop bar with the TV on, so don't let that deter you! I will be coming back here again, no doubt.  Comfortable beds, great location and overall great customer service!

title: Great hospitality
text:
The front office manger was excellent (Paul).
Anything that we requested,he made happen.
Thank you for the great service.we will be back again.
He also  took us to the rooftop bar ,that was amazing.we had a great time at somewhere nowhere.

title: Great service, excellent location!
text: First time in NYC! The staffs at Renaissance go out of their way to make me feel welcomed here! They put gifts and card in my room, and I really appreciate the personal touch. It is really an experience! The room is very clean, albeit it is on the smaller side. But hey, it is new york city haha. The bar has decent selections.

title: Underwhelming.
text: This hotel is just ok. It is nowhere close to the quality of normal Renaissance Hotels. It is dark, the restaurant is weak for breakfast, there is no lounge for frequent travelers, and you have to deal with a rooftop bar that is constantly taking up the elevators. The quality of the finishes in the rooms is suspect. The rooms are quite small. I ended up having to call security on multiple occasions due to significant noise. This is candidly my least favorite Renaissance worldwide. If you want a better one in the same brand stay at the midtown one which is much much nicer.

title: The hotel is not safe
text: I would like to report to the hotel that on 30.06, around 22:40, I was attacked by a woman who left the rooftop drunk. It is inappropriate and absurd to mix guests and extremely altered people. because I don't feel safe, I want to cancel the other daily rates and get a refund of the amount paid. We didn't feel safe in this hotel.

title: Not bad but much better choices in the area.
text:
Hotel was fine.  The location is great.  The room looks nothing like the photos online. It’s dingy and dark whereas the online photos are light and bright.  Bar choices looked like a college bar - nothing even close to premium. Was told no upgrade was available ( even tho I didn’t ask ) but they weren’t really very full ( checked online ). . Also received no welcome gift . Asked about it when I left but they said my level doesn’t get one . My benefits state that I do get one. Didn’t even get water in the room . 
Manager was nice -had to ask for her when employee refused my late check out - she gave it to me right away. 
Wouldn’t stay here again - too many choices in new York and the price point on this hotel would indicate 4 stars but the hotel just isn’t that nice.

title: hit or miss
text:
Our three complaints: staff service, amenity fees not living up to the expectation and the elevator.
We made a five hour trip by car to come to the city, we couldn't grab a spot outside the hotel for valet so we were about one or two spots away for now. We went in first and asked what we could do and we were basically told that we still have to pull up regardless of the busy street. I knew something like this would happen: it's the city and parking sucks. But it would've been nice if the staff at least tried to be helpful. It could've been a liability issue but they could've told us that. Check in itself was cold and it felt like they just wanted you out the way. At check out, right as we finished packing the car and got in (it didnt take very long), we were immediately told to move by either a doorman or valet. How can we do that when we cant even get to the road?? I understand, they need to pull around more cars, but being just told to move is especially rude. As someone who has worked in the hospitality industry for a long time, how you say things to customers can form nearly their whole experience and set the tone for their stay. 
This hotel also charges you a $30 amenity fee which you can apply to food. The buffet breakfast was $35 per person I think, which is incredibly expensive since the selection of food that was just the basics (eggs, bacon, bagels etc). This was not ideal for us and not worth it either. In the evening, the menu wasn't as limited which is great because we were all able to get something to eat. But some of the pricing is ridiculous. I know it's supposed to be a "higher end" hotel, but half of the menu items I could get down the block for way cheaper and way better most likely. For a place offering so little for a credit you have to use in order to not be charged for it, they're really trying to give you a marathon for your money. 
The elevator was very hard to use, half of the people we got into it couldn't work it either. The high-tech elevators with touch screens just simply don't work. 
Those complaints aside, there were staff members that genuinely cared about our experience. One front desk agent followed up with us about our housekeeping requests, the bartenders were very attentive despite their big crowds and very personable. Regardless of our feelings about the food, it was still very good and filling (but my chicken was dry). The hotel itself is beautiful and you can walk basically anywhere from it. We still walked to the "major landmarks" like Times Square, Central Park, museums... but we don't mind the walk. We were also able to request a mini fridge for our stay which was very helpful given that we brought some food with us too. I'm not sure if I'd stay again, but other things were able to make up for the things that made us feel it wasn't worth it.

title: Stay here if you need to be in Midtown
text: Stayed for 4 nights on a business trip. Fantastic service from check in to check out. Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable lounge / reception area, comfortable bed and clean / modern bathroom with everything I needed. Good location for midtown or downtown visits. My colleagues wish they booked this place instead of their hotel haha. Didn't try the breakfast, or hit the fitness center or rooftop bar. Nice views.

title: Stay at the renaissance
text: The hotel was clean, the rooms comfortable. The bed and pillows were overly comfortable. All around pleasant experience. Would highly recommend going to this hotel. The bar in the lobby was cool and chic as well. Just wish we had more time in the city to enjoy the hotel more

title: Great Location
text: My stay here was amazing. The services and facilities hotel provides were great. Food is the other thing I need to mention from this hotel which were delicious. Great location, easily accessible to major parts of town.

title: una exelencia de servicio
text: exelwnte servicio y atención  especialmente gracias a julio morales por su excelente atención  la seguridad  que ofrece el hotel  las facilidades  nos fuimos muy contentos y felices por su servicio  los recomendáremos a nuestros familiares y amigos

title: Very friendly service
text:
Nice hotel with very very nice service and staff. I travelled with friends and stayed for eight nights. Two of us stayed at double room 705 and one of us had own room 708. Nice comfortable beds, lots of pillows - good ones - which was very nice. Hotel also gave free bottles of water every day which was super nice.
Surprisingly little space for clothes.... very little closet in the double room. In the shower the water tap was little tricky but we learned to get hot water.
Wi-fi worked nicely. Rooms were cleaned nicely every day.
They had a breakfast buffet and served every morning scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, bacon, bagels, bread, fresh fruit, fresh strawberries and blueberries, porridge, yogurt and some sweet. Juices, coffee and tea. Some mornings they also served pancakes and fried potatoes as well as some kind of sausages. If you can't eat yogurt and don't like porridge.... quite a limited selection for eight mornings so some mornings we went to diner. 
Location was ok - subway stations were quite close. Also Madison Square Garden where we watched hockey one night was in walking distance. 
If I would choose a hotel for 8 nights' city break again I would choose a different location however. The kind where there are lots of good restaurants nearby in walking distance. But the hotel itself was nice and I could stay there again if just the location would be different.

title: Excellent customer service
text:
I can’t thanks Leonardo and Chris enough for making mine and my wife’s stay for our anniversary super special! A suite upgrade, in room amenities and more, were truly amazing and that coupled with the amazing customer service of everyone at the property was above and beyond.

Great location, really cool decor, and excellent customer service make this property
My go to every time I’m in Manhattan!

title: ok but far from good
text: Nice entrance, very good bellman...Julio makes you feel special.....they need more people like him.....Room tiny, nowhere to put anything...very noisy hallway at all hours...no refrigerator to keep a cold drink....overall a very fair hotel...had to call for towels daily....

title: I <3 Renaissance NYC!
text: If I’m ever in New York, I’m always staying at Renaissance. Our room was closer to the rooftop, where it can get a bit noisy late at night. But, the view of the city was absolutely breathtaking so it was well worth it. Just pack some earplugs and you’ll be fine.

title: Five Star Service from Vincent
text: Five Star Service from Manager Vincent. I stayed for New Year's Eve and January 1. Upon arriving at around 8pm, Vincent or Vinny, the manager on duty could see that I was having a rough night with the drenching rain. I called two nights before to inquire about a suite upgrade. When I got there Vincent was able to upgrade me to one of their finest suites. It was mind blowing for my birthday, and he really went the extra mile in making certain I had everything I needed for this special occasion.  He deserves to be the manager of this facility. His devotion to customer service truly shows, and he shines in his role and deserves a raise. Marriott, take not of this rising star in the hospitality industry.

title: Lovely hotel with really caring staff.
text:
Lovely hotel with really caring staff. 

I stayed for 5 nights with my wife, 11yo and 8yo boys in February. We were super excited about the kids first visit to NYC. Hotel was nicely located within reasonable walking distance of all the areas we wanted to see. 

We had an unfortunate incident outside on the street just after arriving in NY, which had nothing to do with the hotel. It took the shine off our vacation. I mentioned it in passing to the hotel's 'Navigator' (like a super helpful customer liaison manager), Leonardo P, and he brought over the manager, Vincent C.  Even though my situation had nothing to do with the hotel, they wanted to help as were grateful that we had chosen to stay with them. They were ind enough to upgrade us to a larger room and even placed gifts for my kids in the room (and some wine for the grown ups). it was super thoughtful and helped turn the vacation around into an awesome experience that the kids will never forget.

Chelsea is a great location for exploring NYC, slightly away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but easy to get to. Like all places in NYC at the moment there is a homeless problem and you need to have you wits about you at all times of the day. But despite that it is still an amazing life experience to visit.

On behalf of my wife and kids, thanks Leonardo and Vincent for being so cool and caring, and thanks Renaissance Chelsea for being home from home for the week.

title: Sleek new hotel
text:
We decided to stay at this hotel as it is within walking distance to our relatives. As with many other hotels in NYC this hotel sits on a small plot of land and only has about 8 to 10 rooms per floor. The rooms are rather small but are well equipped with interesting touches. The property offers a small bar and restaurant on the main floor. Free bottled water is always available in the lobby which was a nice touch. Breakfast was included with our status and it offered a decent selection of items. As with many hotels in NYC this property also charges a "resort fee" without any resort offerings. You can use your $25 'non cumulative' credit at the restaurant or bar. The problem is that the bar is closed for part of the afternoon and if you have plans in the evening you won't be able to utilise your credit, convenient for the hotel but not for the guest. I wish that 'non resort properties' will give up charging such silly fees. The hotel shares one of the elevators with an external night club - it didn't bother us during our stay and we were on a high floor an had no negative experiences with either long lines for the elevator nor noise across the hotel.
Overall it was a good experience and I can recommend the property to anyone staying around Chelsea and the Flat iron district.

title: Top Notch Service
text: I stay here 4-6 times a year. It’s convenient to my job but I have other options. I choose this property for the staff. Vincent Copobianco is super welcoming. Always makes me feel welcome. The property has a modern hip aesthetic and it’s quiet. Yes, amazing insulated windows. Get a high floor and you won’t hear any street noise.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel in NYC. Booking process was super easy on booking.com. Checking it was super fast and efficient. They offer complimentary snacks in the lobby and there’s a bar and restaurant downstairs. Included in your fees is a $25 charge you can apply to drinks or food you get from the restaurant or bar but if you don’t use it you loose it which kind of stinks. Elevators are very technological and a little confusing at times to use. But the hotel itself is very clean and updated. Smart tvs in room. The room itself was a bit small but very clean so we didn’t mind. We visited the rooftop club Somwhere Nowhere so this was a good location for that. Great stay for an overnight trip.

title: Great location, comfortable beds
text:
I stayed four nights and the location is excellent, plenty of food, dining, great markets on either avenue near hotel.  The hotel is new and stylish. The room I felt while efficient felt very compressed.  There was a small desk and a minimalist desk chair and it wasnt terribly comfortable.  The bed was great.  I requested and got a mini fridge which was difficult to place anywhere given the room size/layout.

As with many full service hotels in NYC, they add an 'amenities fee' that is frustrating.  You get some comp's in laundry and food/bev credits but given the prices for anything there, you wont recoup it without going out of pocket further.  Most people I suspect don't get it back.  I find this practice as annoying and voiced my concern on checkout.  I wish they would do away with it and just reflect it in the room rate as things used to be that way.
The gym was alright, on the warm side in the basement. As others remarked there is a lively night club and a lot of people around the lobby and elevators.  They had a bouncer there and a dedicated elevator for the patrons of the club.  It was not a big deal waiting as the remaining elevators were fast and operating.  
Theres no club lounge at this hotel for marriott elites, they give some points instead.

title: ok stay
text: I stayed here in December. My stay was alright. Nothing exceptional and there were a lot of drunk people from the club next door in front of the hotel. I thought the hotel should have done a better job with crowd control.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We had a great experience at the Renaissance NYC Chelsea. All of the staff members that we encountered were friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, bed and pillows were very comfortable, the bathroom was nice. Overall an excellent stay!

title: Different experience!!
text:
I stayed at this hotel for about 17 nights . And i changed my room 3 times at different nights because of the AC which wasn’t working properly. The last room they gave me has a great view of the empire state building . The complimentary coffee was always there also you could grab water at the front desk. Most of the front desk are perfect except a one or two who are not that friendly others were really helpful.

The breakfast was not on the room and it was ok . They haven’t tried to bring up new things or at least change some items so everything was always the same .

The most annoying part is the noise coming from the club which is located at the roof top of the hotel and specifically at the weekend wouldn’t let you sleep till 4 am . I had a bad experience of an extra noise from the room above me which gave me headache and i called the front desk several times so you could imagine paying around $300 p/n and couldn’t sleep . 

The worst part was the new years night i think it was Saturday night 1st of January the black guy was sitting in front of the restaurant and i asked if the restaurant is open which wasn’t. So he start talking to me and I politely answered that from which country i coming from and he talked about politics and the normal conversation.Later on he saw me again and told me how can i find you to say hi specifically at night ???? Which was disgusting. I don’t know how a personnel would let themselves to be this rude . I didn’t see him again .i hope the person who is in charge will take care of this . 
Overall experience was good . But since i pay cash to extend my stay and they ask for deposit as well i had an experience that they told me your balance is $16 which i asked please double check and they said oh yes it’s $116 !!  And I don’t know how the big hotel like this could made a huge mistake .and when i told that she said i gave you discount i hope you appreciate it!!! I paid almost $5000 for my stay and the extension.

And last but not least when i moved to the second room at night i found the safe box is not open so the staff came and fixed it for me since the AC still didn’t work they gave me a new room for the next day when I supposed to change the room i took my stuff from the safe box and i found a sunglass cover .i called the front desk and told them shall i leave it here and they said they gonna send someone to picked that up . I gave it to the staff and one minute later he knocked at my door and said it is empty . I said i have no idea since I didn’t checked that and not even opened it . Later on the front desk called me and said the same thing !!! It gave me the feeling that i have to know why it is empty ???? So i think the person who pays 17 nights for this kind of expensive hotel obviously doesn’t need a sun glass . So definitely the next time i find anything will leave it there only so the housekeeping will find .

title: Helpful, efficient staff and small, clean rooms in a central location.
text:
This hotel had helpful, efficient staff and small, clean rooms in a central NYC location.

Service and check in at this hotel were lovely. But like most NYC hotels, rooms were on the (very) small side. 

The large-ish shower was a delight. As were the provided small bottles of Pharmacopia shampoo, conditioner and body gel. Two small bars of Aveda soap for the shower and bathroom sink were also provided (and replace daily as necessary).  As were clean bath towels, hand towels, wash cloths and bath mat.  

In a tasteful rustic-modern style, the room was clean, quiet and the bed conformable.  

If I had one gripe, the outside of the windows were curiously *covered* in bird droppings, so what otherwise may have been a partial lovely sunset city view, was marred.  The window opened a sliver, which was great to let out steam after showering. 

The room had a *very* mini, tiny closet space, barely wide enough for a winter coat, a jacket and one dress.  

Breakfast was served downstairs for a fee. They hotel also served at its downstairs bar coffee drinks and a few items for “grab-and-go” breakfasts, such as fruit cups and a yogurt parfait,  Mini-bottles of water were available in the lobby at all times for guests. 

The hotel felt safe and secure. The staff was great.  I would defiantly consider staying again while in the city, or in recommending it to friends whose criteria is a decent area for not too expensive of a price.

title: OUTSTANDING Stay, property and its staff
text: We stayed at the Renaissance for one week from December 28th to January 4th, 2023. From the moment we arrived the check-in person asked how our flight was, if we were needing water or snacks and if there was something special she should know about our room preference.  She accommodated us with a room with a balcony but it was too small for us. That night she found us a larger room with 2 beds. We then ask for extra lamps as the room was a little too dark. We have Titanium status with Marriott and this allows us to request upgrades when available. The Later during our stay, we were moved to one of their suites.

title: Incredible experience!!!
text:
Incredible experience!!!!!
From the moment of the check-In to the checkout !
The staff is incredibly nice and attentive, they recognize you all the time, carefully attentive with your needs, housekeeping staff above and behind ! The location is just amazing, the rooms are incredibly nice and especially clean. Loved the design of the rooms, the balcony, and the entrance. 

Five star to the entire staff !!! Well done !!

title: Modern Hotel in Chelsea
text: We had a great experience staying at the Renaissance New York Chelsea.  This hotel is modern and clean.  We received friendly service checking in/out as well as at the lobby bar.  There are a few Titanium perks, like free breakfast and a discount at the bar, but note that there are not any upgrade options for rooms with 2-beds.  But not to worry because the standard rooms are nice!  The bathroom is decent size, but dimly lit.  A safe and plenty of USB and standard outlets are included in the room.  Bring a noise machine to drown out the conversations, etc coming through the vent from surrounding rooms.  The adjacent club, Somewhere-Nowhere is worth checking out, but it is not affiliated with the hotel, so you're on your own there!  There are a handful of restaurants, bars, cafes nearby as well as the Flower District.  We will definitely consider this spot for our next trip to NYC

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Just returned from staying at this hotel for 3 nights.  What a gem!  I was able to check in early and my room on the 17th floor had a nice view.  The rooms are not as small as I expected compared to other NYC rooms and were very clean.  The housekeeping dept was outstanding during my visit.  They were able to work around my schedule and remain friendly and efficient.  The front desk people both upon checking in and check out were great. I did have to have them correct my room and beverage credit that was not initially given.  But it was done in a fast, friendly way and they were able to call a Taxi without passing me on to somebody else.  The elevator situation was not bad. I think they may have worked out a better system.  We did encounter the patrons going up to the club "somewhere, nowhere" on the top floor but it seemed like they had their own elevator and hotel and/or club staff were vigilant keeping the club goers away from hotel elevators.  The club I think was using some room in the lobby as a coat check.  Finally the hotel bar staff were great.  After coming in around 11:30 pm from a long day in the city I had a nice glass of win that I ordered just as "last call" was being given for drinks at the lobby bar.  I was not rushed in any way and as a matter of fact I was encouraged to sit, relax and finish my drink.  I saw the same bartender treat all of the bar guests with respect and efficiency - -  even when some were not returning the courtesy.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Family
text: The lobby is warm and the bar is inviting. And so nice to have treats available! We love this Hotel!!! The staff is amazing!!!!! Christian was so sweet! The room was clean and spacious. Definitely will return to this hotel!

title: No Elevator Access to My 18th Floor Room
text: Renaissance dedicates 2 of their 3 operating elevators to a private club, leaving one functioning elevator for paying hotel clients.  As a result, the one elevator is jammed full all the time and people queue up to get to their rooms.   I had to walk up 18 floors to get to my room.  And, all staff know it is a problem as I even passed two cleaning staff in the stairwell as they know the one elevator is full of paying clients.  To top it off, the several elevator attendants working the night club were rude, telling us to stand back away from the two working elevators servicing the night club.  This hotel solves for serving the club guests and punishes the hotel guests.  It may be the worst hospitality experience I have ever had.  I not only will never stay at this hotel again, I’m taking all Renaissance hotels off my travel plans in the future.

title: When staying in NYC
text:
There was leakage in our bathroom on 2nd night. Had to ring staff THREE times to get someone up to check the leakage. We had to shift rooms at 11+pm! Rooms shifted was smaller and not to what we initially had. The very next morning we had to shift to another room lower level and no view. Reception mentioned that there will be a compensation for the inconvenience but upon checking out nothing was being compensated.
Connection to room WiFi was complicated. It could have been simplified since it free WiFi. Why all the hassle to make payment and refund later. 
The only thing that was great was that there was $21 usd food and beverage credit included in the hotel package.

title: Great hotel, good location
text:
Some reviews were critical, but we enjoyed the Renaissance Chelsea.  Staff was very accomodating, room was quite and quite comfortable.  As others have said, don't get stuck under the rooftop bar;  The front desk advised we did not want to be there due to the noise.  Looks like a lively place however.
Will stay here again.

title: Lackluster property with noisy rooftop nightclub - Beware if you need quiet or upscale stay
text:
My room and experience was nothing like the website describes! I was meeting my friends who were running the marathon and really needed a nice long relaxing quiet weekend. I had noted in my profile that I wanted a quiet room away from elevators, etc., yet when I went up to my room on the 35th floor it was a bit rough around the edges. the view was fantastic of the city, yet that didn’t make up for the fact that it was extremely tiny, threadbare towels, tiny bathroom and the list goes on. Unbeknownst to me, at around 11pm the 1st night I was hearing loud club music, thinking it was in the hallway or something. No, it carried on and at midnight called the front desk. They informed me it was the nightclub a few floors above me on the rooftop, which they failed to mention at check-in. after scrambling, they moved me to an even smaller room until they could find something they next day. Of course, by then it was 1pm & had a hard time getting back to sleep. When I got back later the next day to get a different room, management was nice enough to take off the daily fee + give me a couple of breakfast vouchers. Granted the $25 daily fee is steep and not entirely sure what you get for that. The room I was moved to was away from the nightclub which was a plus, I wasn’t upgraded which you would think that they would have done something for my troubles. The towels were threadbare in this room as well and looked like the room could have been refreshed as it was beat up pretty bad. For the price, I would have thought that the rooms were a bit more upgraded like the pictures shown on the website. 
No room service, tiny tiny tiny gym, no ice machines that I was aware of, plastic cups in the room, 2 towels that were very worn and a host of other negatives that I won’t be returning to this property again. The manager was nice, but I would say that this is not worth the money paid as the overall experience was lackluster. 
In addition, I was not greeted as a Bonvoy member, nor given any amenities for my 4 night stay.

title: Ren Bon Voy in Cheslea
text: Hotel in NYC - so far, the lobby is terrific! There’s a short wait for our early check in but the front desk clerk convinced us that it would be worth it to keep the room assigned. The bday celebration has landed in Manhattan and happy to be here at the Bon voy property.

title: Good but far from great
text:
The hotel is new and nice. The rooms are well decorated and high spec. The air conditioning works brilliantly. The room view was great. 

I wish the rooms was bigger, but it is NYC. I also wish there was more drawer space.

The service at the hotel is generally good. Every time I asked for towels they ignored how many I asked for and brought 2-3x as many! The room didn’t have a mini fridge and they brought one over quickly. 

It’s a bunch of little things that prevented me from giving it more stars. 

The breakfast leaves a lot to be desired. It’s a higher end version of what you’d get at a Residence Inn. It was also consistently cold because no one lit the burners under the metal trays - at least two of the three things (eggs, potato and bacon) were off every day. One day there was no hot water only coffee. If you asked the staff they’d fix it but you had to ask. 

The hotel rooftop pool - we never figured out how to access it. We were told it wasn’t open “until the fall, you know that season before summer”. That was part of the reason we picked the hotel - to be able to use the pool. However there was one floor where there were parties. It was loud at night. I thought this was the rooftop bar but that can’t be right if it is closed until the spring. 

The WiFi cut in and out a couple of times during our stay which made business Zoom calls challenging. Only a couple of times but enough to be irritating. 

And one day they didn’t come to clean our room until 3pm. And they only clean until 5pm. That isn’t a big deal but it meant no room cleaning that day. 

The other thing that got me is that the hotel charges a $25 daily fee, but gives you back a $25 credit on food (if you spend at least $50) and does the same with laundry with a $20 credit (if you spend at least $25). Our little one needed some baby clothes washed bc of an accident. We gave the front desk a few items and labeled the baby stuff as best we could given the form is designed for grown ups. They decided to charge us $12 for a onesie when men’s undershirts are charged $9. Weird nickel and diming behavior. 

I told my wife this plays tries hard to be a cool boutique hotel and give off that vibe, but some of the things make it feel a lot more like a Residence Inn. I think if we had to do it again we’d rather stay at the W Hotel in Union Square. Much better experience all around.

title: Shoutout to Julio!
text: Great hotel and super friendly staff! Shout out to Julio who was always in such a great mood and super helpful! The rooms are spacious enough especially for NY standards and CLEAN! Would def stay there again!

title: Julio is FANTASTIC!
text: Julio at the Renaissance New York Chelsea Hotel was fantastic. He always had a smile on his face - any time of day or night. And he would often be dancing in the lobby to put a smile on my face. He was also very helpful when checking in or checking out. Thank you Julio!

title: Ondermaatse beleving
text:
Goed gelegen hotel. Kamer en badkamer ruim voor New York. Minpunt was dat men de eerste dag onze kamer en badkamer vergeten was te kuisen en de bedden op te maken. Dit is zeer frustrerend na een lange dag NYC.
Daarenboven was het rooftop zwembad gesloten zonder ons te verwittigen.

Zeer Onaangenaam was dat ze 2x een garantie hebben genomen op mijn Visa kaart waardoor deze was geblokkeerd. Niet echt klantvriendelijk. Ik ga er niet meer terug.

title: Good enough that I want to try it again next time I come visit
text: I had a brief stay here in a small room on a lower floor.  Sleep quality was better than expected (esp wrt noise and light which I am sensitive to both).  Elevators were reasonably quick and I was nervous since there were only really 3 in action.  The front desk was helpful and I loved how they just had water bottles out - need me some hydration after flying in and staying out!  There's not really a bar scene but since you are charged a resort fee or something, you can just redeem a glass of wine or a drink in the evenings which we did.  I did check out the lounges/bars at the top - 1 floor had a swing/jazz dance thing going on - not quite my scene but was cool to peak in.  Didn't get a chance to check out the gym/pool which I very much want to next time.  What I really liked was the location - so walkable.  Lots of things nearby - stores, restaurants, etc.

title: The Most Amazing Stay
text:
Great location, interior, bar, restaurant and nightclub. I really enjoyed my stay and the staff were all incredible lovely. Big thank you for upgrading me and leaving treats in my room for my 30th birthday. 

The location was perfect, 15 min walk to midtown and 15 min walk the other way to downtown.

A special shout out to James at the front desk for being incredible polite and also to Svetlina at the bar. She was lovely and makes the best cocktails. Personal favourite the Margarita & Espresso Martini - I have tried a lot and these were the best I have had.

Only critique would be to warn guests on high floors of the noise from Somewhere Nowhere.

title: Disappointing
text:
I am currently at the hotel, and I am very disappointed.
The strong points are the location, the view of the rooms (on the Empire state building) and the comfort of the mattresses.
but the customer experience is disappointing.
We booked 7 nights and during our week, we thought we would have access to the hotel's rooftop and swimming pool. Impossible ! unless you book like other non-hotel guests.
The most disappointing thing is that we are leaving in 3 days. Our plane is in the evening and we have to leave the room for noon. I wanted to book 1 more night, to enjoy a few more hours (to take a shower and be fresh for my evening flight). The hotel told me ok for 850 € per night extra (twice the usual price). I expressed my astonishment, and reminded that I only needed the room for 6 hours more, they offered me 4 hours more for 450 dollars ... what a shame!
spending a week in their establishment, I expected more consideration.
The experience is unsatisfactory.
For the same location, I would recommend other neighboring hotels (Motto Hilton for example).

title: The best employee julio !!!!
text:
julio is the best employee, very nice friendly and always available. it was the best of this hotel . when you arrive at the hotel ask for the best employee JULIO!
The hotel was good but the food is very bad.

title: What a pleasant surprise!
text: I moved from a Times Square hotel where my room was old and the size of a closet to the Renaissance Chelsea.  I used points for the stay and the manager Jessica greeted me by name and told me that she had been working on my reservation and was happy to upgrade me to a suite.  They offered the standard points and also offered points in lieu of breakfast, along with a late checkout.  This was wonderful and much appreciated.  What I appreciated even more was the beautiful, spacious, clean suite with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building and New York City.  Beautiful art throughout and nice clean furniture. Even though the room as ADA, it was still nice and I felt so relaxed in this space vs coming from a space that was brown, small, noisy and hot/humid. Oh, they also gave me a brand new (still in the package) compact umbrella for the threatening evening rain.  - I will definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC!

title: Great location! Nice rooms.
text: Great location. Nice hotel. Main floor outdoor seating is lacking ambience but inside small bar was decent. Free water bottles and breakfasts were very good! Room was nice, only complaints were that ESPN didn’t come in properly. They were aware of this ongoing issue but have not corrected it. Also, great rooftop terrace (39th floor) with a pool but not owned by them so access was difficult and limited.

title: Great stay!
text:
We stayed here for a week and had a great stay.
Upon arrival we were lucky to meet Miriam who went out of her way to make sure we had a great stay.
As Platinum Elite we were upgraded to a larger room and offered free breakfast.
The breakfast buffet needs to improve ( it doesn’t even have cream cheese…)

The hotel has one major disadvantage : it has a rooftop bar ( that is not part of the hotel but the bars guests still use the hotel elevators and walk around the lobby, sometimes drank and late at night).

All in all, a very good stay , not the first and definitely not the last!
Luckily we met Miriam who made this an excellent stay!

title: Lovely stay
text: I was a little nervous to stay here based on the reviews. In the past we have stayed at the Essex House and the St Regis. We are Titanium and I do consider myself to be picky. Having said all that we really  enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance NY Chelsea. The hotel is stylish, very welcoming. I thought every single employee we had interaction with was pleasant. I had requested a low floor due the night club noise. We were on the 4th  floor and I did not hear a thing.( not even street noise)  No view from the room but that was ok since we were not in there much. We only had trouble getting an elevator once. ( Saturday around 7pm) Great location. We walked everywhere! The pool is not part of the hotel but guest have access to it certain hours. We just popped up for some photos. It is an amazing view. We had the American breakfast one day which was perfect. I would stay here again. Really a great value, which is nice when you need to get 2 rooms! Also the area is safe. I was worried. And if you like gelato Anitas in flatiron is amazing!!!

title: Great experience- wonderful staff.
text: Beautiful hotel. Must acknowledge Julio, bellman He is so friendly and helps any way he can. This is a man who goes out of his way for guests. He always has a smile on his face and makes you feel so welcome. I wish every hotel I stayed at , had a Julio. Every time we entered the lobby he greeted us with a warm hello and smile. Julio made our stay memorable and we look forward to seeing him when we return .

title: Very Misleading
text: The pool was not active and there is a fee to get to the rooftop because supposedly the rooftop and hotel are not the same entity. Very poor advertising. My wife and I had to book another hotel from all the issues we encountered, one of which was the water was cold.

title: Don’t stay here
text:
Terrible experience. I have a credit card which I specifically instructed to not charge, only for the deposit. Ofcourse this amateur hotel charged it. I replaced the card and ofcourse they charged the same amount on the second card, the little problem is, that they never returned me 600$ to the first card. 1,5 weeks I AM WAITING, I am calling to the accounting department, nobody answers. I am calling to reception, answer one in 5 times and then they tell me to call the accounting department. Zero responsibility for stealing from me. I have to waste my time calling you 10 times? 

The downstairs bar is pathetic, the bartender was never there, he didn’t set his priorities even when he was, never asked who was first, so I DINT GET A SINGLE drink in 10 days staying there. One time my friends got a drink finally, we waited maybe 30-40 minutes too. 

They were always chatting in reception and the lines were huge, nobody answered the phone. 

Thank you for stealing from me and being the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in NYC. Pathetic

title: A sad goodbye lightened up
text:
It’s been a rough few weeks for me. Mom was diagnosed with cancer and I have to travel abroad to help her during her treatment. I will be gone for two months. T’was two days before I leave… and needed to celebrate my boyfriend a little earlier before I leave and we chose this hotel.
 
BEST DECISION!! 

They surprised us with an amazing selection of desserts and a bottle of wine with a hand written note from the amazing Leonardo Pacheco. I hadn’t even met him before he delivered the treats. 

I had however mentioned the celebration to the front desk agent Wesley who not only organized for us to have a beautiful room on a high floor with amazing views. But also ensured he shared with Leonardo to deliver the delights.  

I chose this hotel because I had family in town a couple of months ago and they stayed here. They said it was the best stay they had in Manhattan. The front desk agents, the housekeepers, the door men and everyone we encountered were exceptional. At the time because I didn’t stay, I only visited my family, I didn’t get their names. But it was because of the way my family raved about the hotel that I decided to give it a shot. Now because of this exceptional service they have gained a loyal local! I want to shout from the rooftops how great they are. 

Thank you!!! I needed this. It’s been rough and I have a tough journey ahead. You definitely made my last summer night in New York memorable.

title: Now my go-to hotel in NYC
text:
One of the best hotel experiences I've had in numerous trips to NYC.   This hotel checked all the key boxes for me.   Quiet rooms, clean, comfortable beds, great location, friendly & professional staff, and good amenities.

I'll list the few small negatives first - small room - although OK for NYC, room windows directly across from another hotel so limited privacy, no in-room mini-fridge although they could bring one up, and no Marriott club room.

The positives far outweighed the negative and while I'm not often in Chelsea, this is on my list of go hotels to stay at in the future.

title: Amazing stay at Renaissance Chelsea Hotel
text: My family and I had such an amazing time at the luxury New York City hotel. Our room was clean, modern and with the best NYC views. We enjoyed swimming at the Rooftop pool lounge and shopping in the local area just blocks from Macy’s Herald Square. The Front Desk staff was the best and went out of there way to accommodate our needs. I definitely would recommend staying here if you are visiting NYC and we look forward to going back again soon.  Ishmael Alvarado & Family. (Marine Corps Veteran)

title: Beautiful Hotel with Stunning Rooftop
text: Stayed here on a business trip for a few days. The hotel is beautiful but the lounge upstairs and rooftop is absolutley stunning. Service on rooftop was amazing compared to what I have experienced elsewhre in Manhattan. Will be coming back for another stay.

title: Nice Hotel no respect for guests
text:
Nice hotel but we realized that the pool
Is only available from 8 am to 11 am on Sunday because the poll is turned into a private bar. Please avoid this hotel they do not deserve your business with this attitude especially when is not specified in the hotel description. Shame on them

title: Horrible stay
text: Stayed here for business expecting a luxury experience and felt like I was at a two star motel. How can this be a 5 star property with hotel rooms with no hot water, horrible restaurant service and incompetent front desk every time you call with a request. The only luxury experience I got was up at the rooftop/pool as service & hospitality  was impeccable for afterwork cocktails. They had amazing live jazz bands on our visit. Will come to visit the rooftop but will not be staying here again

title: Private club nonsense and resort fees
text:
Traveled from Bay Area for a week of meetings in NYC office with coworkers from London.

Booked based on it being a Marriott (expectation of quality/comfort), having a rooftop lounge area, and a pool.

Could not use the rooftop lounge/bar because it is a private club. Were told after waiting in line one late afternoon that we needed hand stamps and to visit the hotel desk to get them. Bouncer/host also wanted us to get back in line to await being permitted to enter. Ultimately this was too much hassle for an after-work drink so we went elsewhere.

Not very welcoming.

Expected to be treated as a welcomed guest all week, not jump through hoops to get access to rooftop lounge after work.

Hotel charges a $25/day resort fee. Considering how hard it is to use the "resort", I found this to be ridiculous.

Location, views, room comfort, and lobby staff were very good. Just miffed about having no place at the hotel to spend down time during the long work week.

title: Not recommended
text:
Room did not have any fridge or water during entire our 5 stay. Peak summer time and 5 star hotel with no fridge and no water 
Never seen in life any five star hotel like this.
Breakfast is paid but very limited option. You are forced to pay 15-20% gratuity as part of the bill despite poor breakfast option

title: Loved Our Stay!
text: Had a wonderful 2 night stay with my wife and 2 boys (age 10 and 12)!  The bellman, Julio was awesome and super nice - teaching my boys dance moves in the lobby, and Mariam at the front desk was lovely as well!  Beautiful property, perfectly located for our NYC getaway! View from our room looked right out at the Empire State Building - short walk to Mad Sq Park, the High Line and Mid-Town.  We were will definitely be back!

title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever
text: The rooms are not maintained. The phone didn't work. The building's hot water was out of service for 24 hours. The shower head sprayed water everywhere except out of the shower head. The Front Desk resolved NONE of our issues (other than to offer us 5000 marriot points to appease us --- when each room was costing us 58,000 points or $450+++).

title: Bellman
text: Julio was amazing! A lot better than the other people at the hotel. The rest of the staff was okay except for the rude guards at the door who asked if we are guest of the hotel almost everytime we walked in the hotel and it was extremely annoying and belittling to be asked that when we paid so much to stay at this hotel.

title: You can hear the party in your room!
text: I stayed last night. When I got to my room, I could hear loud thumping from the pool party going on the roof (was on floor 35). Was told all they could do was re-locate me. When I asked why I wasn't warned about this, they simply said I should have been. Question: why put guests in rooms where they are going to be disturbed...at a "nice" hotel like this? Desk people rude about this too like I should have known. Will NOT be returning.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
This hotel has real potential but there are too many inconveniences to not note them. 

TLDR: I love Renaissance properties but this one left too much to be desired. 

Pros-
* Beautiful newer property. One of the best Marriott hotels I’ve stayed in the NYC chelsea area. 
* Plenty of bottled water provided complimentary at the front desk. 
* the property’s gym is adequate. Good amount of space and towels/bottled water available + core gym necessities.

Cons—
* Service is severely lacking at ALL areas of this hotel- starting with the front desk but I will say the absolute worst service was the staff at the Cotto restaurant for breakfast (more on that shortly)

* $25 “destination fee” for no amenities except bottled water is astonishing. They will offset spending at the hotel on food and beverage with this fee - and trust me, you’ll use it at that nightmare of a breakfast restaurant - Cotto. 

* Cotto - where do I begin? I was encouraged when I checked in and learned that Cotto honored either a complimentary continental breakfast or $20 voucher towards breakfast for Platinum elite. This is where everything turned sour with my experience at this place - I visited 4 mornings for breakfast, the first morning was painfully slow (almost 2 hours for 1 person to have breakfast - a simple omelette with toast) and the 3rd morning they refused service due to being “too busy and understaffed” — on a Saturday! The prices at this restaurant are a joke - $20 does not get you much folks. Coffee is $6, juice is $8, toast $4, oatmeal with 3 blueberries and 1 strawberry $18, an omelette that you can only have bacon in for a protein (?) but you could order sausage, salmon on the side of course.  And the rudest staff I have encountered at any Marriott property to boot. It was as if they were really doing me a favor to bring salt and pepper to the table. 

* Rooms are very small. I was upgraded to a room with “20% more room” but really can’t imagine what a smaller room would look like. I did have to use the desk regularly for work and was traveling alone and it was very tight quarters. 

* Pool is not for hotel guests. They should work on allowing some dedicated hours for hotel guests at the pool considering we are inconvenienced by the club the entire stay. 

* check in was a disaster. Granted I requested an early check in and understandably those are not guaranteed - however, I did the mobile check in and then chatted w the front desk and they said they could not add me to their “waiting list” for check in until I arrived in person at the property - what is the point of mobile check in if you require folks in person? Seems redundant and the hotel should consider using the mobile check in as their waiting list since that’s what every other Marriott property does.

title: POOL is not for hotel guest!  Cotto restaurant is a mess! Small room but nice views!
text:
Pool is an entire different business, NOT AN AMENITY for hotel guests!  TripAdvisor AND Marriott needs to update this critical information! Plus, during the busy weekends it causes problems for hotel guests with noise and ability to use two out of four lifts!  All reviews about issues with lifts is indeed correct because we experienced it!
We got ‘upgraded’ to a corner King on the 27th floor, which offered incredible views but the room is the size of a walk-in closet!  We were offered a 20% bigger king room starting our second night, but who wants to move!?!??
Our shower drain was clogged constantly and never fixed by hotel!  We just took our own action to make it work. Cabinet hinge broken which make 50% of drawer space very unusable. 
They offer Marriott Platinum members a good fixed bfast at their only restaurant Cotto, but the restaurant is small and outdoor is not open. When we do pickup order, it’s always wrong!  
They also offer a daily CR of 25.00 to offset the resort fee, nice idea but with only one restaurant it’s tiring for a 7 days stay!
Overall impression, nice newer property if u don’t mind all the inconveniences, and don’t overpay!  I would say 200 or lower would be reasonable.

title: So-so
text:
Things I wish I had known: 1) They charge a $25/night resort fee, you’re able to use this in the restaurant, bar, laundry etc, but they don’t tell you this at check-in so didn’t know until check-out; the laundry is closed on Sundays. Felt misleading. 2a) The rooftop and pool are not available to hotel guests; if you want to visit, you have to reserve with a $100/per person minimum. Misleading given the photos, was hoping to have a quiet place to do some work outside. 2b) The rooftop is actually a club so on the weekend there’s a long line of club-goers outside the hotel and one of the inside elevators is dedicated to the club. I didn’t have any noise issues on the 21st floor but definitely something to check. 

Other than that, the rooms are new and the location is convenient, especially for coming in and out of Penn Station. The service was so-so.

title: Excellent service with kindness
text:
I stayed for four nights at the hotel recently and had a wonderful experience. It was a last minute trip due to a personal emergency, and the hotel team ensured that I had a pleasant stay. I was placed in a quiet room on the lower floors, which was calming to come back to each evening.

Thanks to Paul and his team, including Amani, Omar and the folks at Cotto restaurant, I really appreciated every interaction, your professionalism, but even more so your kindness.

title: Not Ready for Prime Time
text:
A colleague and I recently booked a few rooms, 4 nights, mid-week, for a business engagement hosting out of town visitors in NYC. Because I was working, I needed a few amenities: room service, shipments to the front desk, a quiet room…and not much more. Upon check-in it became apparent that Renaissance Chelsea hotel was challenged in providing these very basic amenities, for the “bargain” rate of $600-$800/night, for a single king room. After flying in on a red-eye from the West Coast, upon check-in, I was told the room I booked would not be ready until later in the day. I had to point out the actual calendar date to the reception associate, and also remind them that I had specifically booked the room a night in advance in order to check-in when I arrived early in the day. Once that was sorted out, I made my way to said designated room, only to find that the room key was inoperable.  Though it was cumbersome and time consuming, I was moved to another room. 

While the hotel did make an effort to accommodate my room request (quiet and away from the club on the 30th floor), the hotel restaurant and morning room service was among the worst I have experienced, anywhere. I was required to rise early and attempted to order in-room delivery of, 1) a pot of tea, and 2) toast. Both items appear on the in-room dining menu. First morning, I was told by the woman running the dining service, “No toast. Only bread.” Day two, I attempted to refill my tea cup with hot water directly FROM the restaurant downstairs, and was informed by the SAME woman, “No hot water.” A short walk down the hall to the coffee station revealed, a) coffee to go, b) hot water, and c) all the necessary accoutrements (cups, milk, sweetener, etc.)  This woman was by far the rudest, most hostile “hospitality” worker I have encountered, anywhere. It is worth noting that my requests were made politely and patiently, and I have no pre-existing gripe, disagreement or relationship with any of these people.

From there, items that were shipped to the front desk for business purposes were misplaced.  I was told they had not arrived (they had, and surfaced after much back and forth and several phone calls.) 

The worst experience of the stay was when a tragic incident occurred on my floor in the room across the hall. I returned to my room one afternoon, and encountered several NYPD officers stationed outside the door. I asked if there was cause for concern, and was not fully satisfied with the response. Leaving the room an hour later and encountering two new NYPD, I inquired again if there was cause for concern. The officer then explained what had happened, and a short time later I witnessed emergency workers pushing a gurney up the hallway. It is worth noting that at no time during my 4 days as a guest did the hotel notify me that there was an “incident” and I was likely to encounter this scene upon returning to my room. Nor did they offer to move me to a new room…or offer any explanation whatsoever. Once the matter was resolved, the room remained sealed with NYPD tape for the remainder of my stay. Come ON, Marriott! I expect more from a company of this size and reputation.

We paid more than $3,000 for a 4-night stay accompanied by some of the worst service I’ve encountered, anywhere. I will add, there was one very helpful “navigator” named Leonardo who deserves props for good customer service. Also, the rooms were clean. Aside from that, this hotel needs a lot of improvement. Cannot recommend.

title: Highly recommend staying in Chelsea at The Marriott Renaissance. Our Bellman, Julio was so helpful and friendly with us
text: Our Bellman, Julio, from the Dominican Republic is so terrific!  He’s very kind, helpful and friendly.  And he’s a great dancer!  The hotel is very clean and bar had a decent wine list.  We used the gym facilities each day where there is bottled water and fresh towels of course. It has become our favorite place to stay in NY

title: Good NYC hotel
text:
Pros :
- front desk staff were wonderful and truly understand the art of customer service.
- room (albeit small, but standard for New York) had very high ceilings on the 11th floor and are new and fresh
- restaurant was good.  The food was tasty and moreover the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Everything was served with a smile and they went out of their way to accommodate my family.
- location was excellent for my needs.  I loathe Times Square and tourist traps, so this was a wonderful location in Chelsea.  We are a walking family, so walkable to things we like to do in NY (Flatiron, Madison Park, etc) but may not be as good  for people who want to spend more time in the crowded chaos of Times Square.  It is a very short Uber ride to the Theatre District.
- I read other reviews complaining about noise.  I heard nothing from our neighbours and I heard no noise from the rooftop bar or the street.  It was very quiet.  The 11th floor was perfect!

Cons : 
- elevators are SLOOOOW.  Four elevators, but one tends to be reserved for private rooftop club not available to hotel guests. 
- rooms are dark.  Needs more lighting.
- it’s disappointing that the rooftop pool isn’t available to hotel guests.  It had previously been advertised as a hotel with a pool, but things have changed.
- for guests who would like more space, the hotel only has a limited number of suites, so it is hard to book them.
- the bartender and the housekeeping staff seemed stressed.  Nothing egregious, but nowhere near as friendly as the front desk staff or the restaurant staff.

Overall a decent stay.   I would consider staying here again.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: Find somewhere else to stay!!  Room was small but perfectly ok. Check-in was friendly and efficient. But the hotel is awful for 2 reasons. 1) there are 4 elevators but when leaving at 6pm it took nearly 30 mins to get one (2 were permanently in use by housekeeping and the 3rd was used by a guy from the rooftop who said he doesn’t work for the hotel so he wasn’t letting anyone in).  2) breakfast is truly abysmal

title: Personal and warm
text: Everyone we encountered at the hotel was personable and hospitable.  The front desk staff is particularly warm and accommodating, and the hotel itself is unexpectedly inviting and almost cozy, especially for a large corporation hotel in NYC.  The location, at least for us, couldn't be more convenient - nestled between Whole Foods, 2 Bros Pizza, and Whole Foods, your choice of fresh grocery products or restaurant food is yours, and the area feels safe with multiple attractions within walking distance including Madison Square Garden.  On a personal note, my husband and I must mention Jessica by name, as she is absolutely delightful, attentive, patient, and so friendly and helpful - and made our stay and trip awesome!  Paul is the manager and oversees an excellent, affable, and helpful front desk staff - Lauren and Lucy (now in sales) are wonderful too!  Pauls's suggestion for Brooklyn Bagel (just a block or two away) was perfect!

title: Great Stay in the City
text: Julio the bellman was the master of great first impressions! Greeted us with a smile and bottles of water! Neighborhood was decent and not touristy. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and shower had great water pressure.

title: Wonderful Staff!
text: We stayed here for 5 days and we’re very impressed with the staff. Julio and Cristian were so helpful with all our luggage, and getting us cabs. They were so friendly and nice, and treated us very well. Julio’s dancing always made us smile. I didn’t get her name, but there was a very attentive and friendly waitress who was so helpful to us and my daughter.  The rooms are clean and nice decorated. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely stay at the Renaissance hotel in Chelsea
text:
The room was nice and clean. Check-in was smooth and the front desk was very accommodating as my friends and I wanted rooms on the same floor. 
Upon arrival, Mr. Julio is there to greet you in the lobby - He was wonderful and was always checking in to see if you needed anything :)

title: Paper thin
text: We could actually hear people in next room having a conversation,and they were talking not loud at all. I have never experienced this.it wa as if they were in the same room . Nice looking hotel ,bad restaurant terrible lunch and the waitress left .the cook served and cooked  . Should be 2 stars

title: Hospitality At It’s Best
text:
The hospitality the staff provided to us as guests made the whole experience! Louie was nothing but professional and went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and showed us how to get around the city! Louie is truly one individual I look forward to seeing again while visiting the Renaissance. Julio was also nothing but professional and courteous to take our luggage all the way to the parking garage. He was very helpful! Please give these two employees the acknowledgement they deserve.
We look forward to seeing all of you at the Renaissance very soon! I also would like to add that Leo and the very sweet front desk guest service clerk were definitely nothing but the most kind, patient and worked very hard to help us settle into our room. Thank you all!!!!

title: Something is badly wrong with this hotel! People need to know before booking because the positive reviews are misleading
text: This hotel provides poor service and poor quality accom. The services compare with a hostel despite the expense. The rooms are dark, lack space and are poorly designed. A refurb would be required to correct this. The breakfast is miserable

title: Great FD!
text:
Good stay. Would stay again. 

Pros-
* Very very friendly staff. I encountered many of the Front Desk agents and they were all fantastic. They really want to please you.
