They helped me with dining suggestions, locating a small fan for the room, as well as getting me in early. I feel terrible I do not know their names but all five stars. I want to say Katie/Keli and Vince were who I encountered the most. 
* good location if you do not want to be in the main tourist area. Near subways, basic shopping, and numerous dining options. Even a small massage parlor across the street which was great. 
* good size room for NY. Our room on the 11th floor had a very high ceiling which was a nice touch and made the room feel large. 
* Room was spotless. 

Cons-
* The Front Desk is cashless and cannot make change. Very annoying for all parties especially as I was trying to get change for gratuities. They need some sort of change bank. 
* The room needed some more light. Very dark. 
* I requested a taxi to the airport. The taxi they ordered us more than twice the cost of yellow cab. I wish I knew that before he got there as I couldn’t refuse service once he arrived. Not sure if it was a taxi or a car service. 

Bottom line- Great hotel. Caring FD.

title: Excellent
text: Friendly and helpful staff....and then there is JULIO!!!  I accidentally tipped him way too much. USD all looks the same!  He sought me out when I came downstairs and returned the extra bill I hadn't intended to give. I couldn't help but give it back to him. Such integrity!  His smile and friendly manner made each interaction so memorable. A gem of fellow in a lovely hotel!

title: Mostly great!
text:
The hotel is nice and located in a great area. The style is nice and staff is great. Julio, the door/bellman, really was a pleasure. Seeing him and having his cheer each day started things off in a great way. 

It would have been nice to have access to the pool, and other areas on the highest levels. Unfortunately there’s a night club in the building, and they get priority over hotel guests in many respects. I really wish that wasn’t the case.

title: I love NY I love Chelsea Hotel
text: Loved our stay and highly recommend this hotel, great location as well. From the moment we spoke with Vinny Capobianco at the hotel we knew we were in for a great stay. He was so accommodating, professional & personable. My daughter is moving to NYC and they made her feel so welcomed and even congratulated her on her new job! Loren Hernandez was so friendly at check in.  Always greeting and acknowledging us throughout our stay. Such a cool vibe & comfortable hotel. The decor is so enchanting & calming in the hallways, with the leaves/ trees back splashes. The room was so clean & housekeeping is daily. Spacious room with high ceilings with a great view! Breakfast buffet is an option & free with certain Marriott privileges. Bottled water available & unlimited in the lobby. We ate a fabulous Italian meal at Cotto in the hotel, Bolognese was delicious. Can’t say enough about the staff & hotel. Thank you for making our stay such a memorable one!

title: Outstanding customer service, well appointed rooms
text:
Front desk and restaurant staff are absolutely warm, welcoming go out if your way to truly welcome you. The hotel is artistic, modern. The views are stunning. The room is sufficient for a couple. We did take the 27th floor and it was quiet as other reviewers stated noise from the rooftop lounge if you go higher. The rooms are clean. The shower is awesome and the beds most comfortable. Really enjoyed the stay. The decor is unique (bunny rabbit lamps in the room). Will be back. The restaurant food was good. We received a $25 voucher so had a chance to use it. If order water at the restaurant you’ll be charged $7. Which we didn’t realize after all it’s just regular water but sparking or bottled. They do provide complimentary water bottles which is very thoughtful and appreciated. 
It’s centrally located. Hotel security is fantastic. They make sure only guests enter in the elevator as there is an assigned elevator for those going to the rooftop lounge. In fact you’ll need your room key to activate the elevator buttons. So very secure and safe. A true Marriott hotel with exemplary service, cleanliness and warmth.

title: Nice property that is actually OPEN
text: Post covid and this hotel actually has daily housekeeping and free breakfast (buffet) for those with status.  Breakfast buffet is OK - eggs pretty weak but fruit is solid and bacon and sausage also OK.  Alice and WOnderland theme throughout - hard to explain but worth the visit.  Well located - free bottled water -pleasant staff.

title: Mariam Front desk!
text:
Very cool hotel in a great location in chelsea! 
The corner room is highly recommended. We stayed in a high floor one and the view was amazing. 
Mariam at the front desk was very nice she helped us a lot and even invited us for breakfast during check out until our cab ride comes

title: Comfortable and Convenient Marriott
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights during a long weekend in March. It was our first time at this particular hotel, but we've been to NYC many times. I think the location is convenient, but it's a bit more gritty in my opinion compared to other areas we've stayed like the financial district and soho. 

The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, extra towels, coffee and water were offered during our stay since we did not have maid service. The room itself was definitely compact although esthetically pleasing. It seems like a lot of the new hotels now have poor storage which is true for this Marriott. For a short stay, I don't think it's a problem. The bed was comfortable and we had a nice view of the city.

Regarding noise, we asked for a lower floor due to the complaints about noise coming from the night club on the top floor. We were on the 25th floor and did not hear any music. There is now one elevator roped off that people use for entering the club, the other elevators are for guests and we didn't have to wait at all getting to and from our room. The walls are definitely thin and we could hear people talking next door. It's unfortunate that the hotel has the club situation preventing people from enjoying a higher floor and better view. We did get a drink from the bar in the lobby, but the bartender definitely prefers the female guests and our drinks were poor. 

Overall our stay was fine, but with so many hotels in the city, I'd be a little hesitant to return given the room size and potential noise issues.

title: Great Hotel in an Excellent Location
text: Stayed one night before a flight from JFK to Asia. Very nice hotel. Great Service Jennifer Chen was especially helpful. The rooms have great views and are ideal for a single traveler or a couple. They are well appointed but small.  The hotel and area businesses were cautious about Covid and had sensible protocols in place. If you need a fast PCR test for international travel, there are many options within walking distance.

title: Beautiful and Quiet NYC Hotel
text: It's so hard to find a beautiful and quiet hotel in New York City. We were so pleased with our stay there and we were easily able to get two adjoining rooms so there was space for us and our three kids. The room with two double beds was larger than we had anticipated for an NYC hotel. The bathroom was really spacious and the guest rooms and the whole hotel were beautifully decorated. We will absolutely stay here the next time we go to the city.

title: We live right near and still would opt to stay or put up guests here. It’s simply great.
text: I visited when they first opened and was actually wowed by the incredibly friendly staff and spotless hotel. I recommend it to anyone (and I’m always asked) who needs to stay in nyc. When pool is open we will surely be doing a staycation. Vince at front desk is just what one hopes for when traveling.

title: Awful experience, awful hotel.
text:
My stay at the renaissance Chelsea has been terrible from the start. First off, the rooms are incredibly tiny and so is their poor excuse of a “fitness center”. 

For $2,000+ for a week stay,  you get a small room, loud nightclub music and domestic violence incidents during the middle of the night. As someone who typical enjoys Marriott hotels and their high level of service, the the renaissance chelsea really dropped the ball! 

Please avoid if unless you want to pay 5 star hotel prices for a 1 star hotel experience.

title: A nice hotel
text:
There was a glitch upon check in . I had used my points for my stay , obviously , the required points were deducted accordingly to get a confirmation no. . But during check in was told that I do not hv enough points . Shown the reservation and points deduction on my screen shots and later they had contacted Marriott Bonvoy to solve the matter . 
No elite member recognition . 
The room  itself is quite nice so that is a consolation. 
The staffs were nice and the location is good

title: Are you new here?
text:
I was looking for a romantic view with a classy ambiance for a little adult role play. I got exactly what I was looking for. The aesthetic was giving what it was supposed to. The staff was very friendly.
-clean room
-quiet on the floor-
- easy check in and out
-bathroom was not only clean but had quality soaps and lotion

Con
- there should be a menu in the room to allow for easy ordering for room service

title: Great hotel but ask for a floor <30
text: Great location. This is a really trendy and friendly hotel. We enjoyed our stay, but be sure to stay below the 30th floor. There is a club on the rooftop that stays open well into the morning and will keep you up all night. We started on 35 and could feel the bass. The next nights we were able to move to 23 and it was perfect.

title: Wonderful Experience. Restored my faith in hotels.
text:
Let meet start by saying that, because off my work, I've had to travel throughout the pandemic. I've seen hotels in the early days not know what to do so basically a stay was a, "here's your key, good luck, make sure to order door dash”—and this is at the premium Marriotts (Ritz-Carlton, Edition, St Regis, JW, Luxury Collection)

As time went on and things started to open up, I had high hopes of hotels getting back to creating great experiences for their guests. Unfortunately, instead of that happening, COVID is being used as an empty excuse just to not rehire people, have bad service, and oh by the way charge more than pre-pandemic prices. The strategy being “since all hotels are doing it, we can charge the same prices and do way less, why stop now!” So basically luxury hotel prices for motel service.

In all of my 130 nights in Marriott’s this year that was the case. No matter how nice the hotel had been or how expensive, every stay was mediocre at best with ALL the compromises and adjustments pushed onto the guest with an incredible lack of empathy from management or staff.

I got used to it and resolved to expect nothing more and just deal with it.

So when I checked into the Renaissance New York Chelsea hotel, it was a shocking surprise. From the second I walked in the door at 7am to check-in and was greeted with a, “no problem and thank you for being an Ambassador” (don’t remember the last time that happened) to the great rooms, to the OPEN lobby bar, to the fact that they actually clean your rooms, to the unbelievably happy and friendly staff. I was there for a business meeting in a conference room and even the catering staff went out of their way to smile and make things pleasant. And the food, and we’re talking buffet food for 40 people, was outstanding.

I thought about it for a while. Was this hotel experience so great because I had be treated like crap for 2 years straight? Or were they just really great? And the answer is they are twice as great at the Renaissance New York Chelsea Hotel. First, they run a beautiful, well oiled hotel with an amazing staff. Second, they do this while all the other hotels in the country are taking advantage of the pandemic situation to not make taking care of their guests not a priority.

Sure, there were some things closed because of COVID at the hotel, but the staff never let you feel the inconvenience.

They next time I check into hotel and they start the conversation about all the things they don’t have, followed by the DoorDash QR code, I’m going to have them call the Renaissance New York Chelsea Hotel to tell them how it’s done.

Thanks everyone.

title: Night Club Hotel
text: I'm not one to do reviews, but I think you need to know: This is night club hotel. It's has a rooftop bar called "Somewhere, Nowhere" and we stayed Friday - Sunday night with  hoards of young people trying to get upstairs to the roof bar. Which means, they used two of the four elevators for the club, which left two to serve the 30 floors of rooms (with 10 rooms on each floor). You'd end up waiting for up to 10+ min for a lift. Then comes the partying. Our first night, "our neighbors" checked in around 3am and one of the "guest" vomited violently until 5am. The sound proofing isn't great, so we heard EVERYTHING through the vests. It was as if the person was vomiting in our room. It was clear they partied too hard and had to check in to the hotel. The continental breakfast in the morning is only good until 8:30am. After that, it's DECIMATED and the kitchen has a hard time keeping up. THEN, you get hit with a $25 fee each day that you won't get back, but you can use it at the bar/restaurant. The location is great, the beds are comfy, but I would 100% pass on this hotel. To cancel this bard review, I'm going to go leave a positive one for The Hilton Garden Inn that's in midtown west that's not exactly a "boutique" hotel, but it's a tried and true hotel that's ALWAYS delivered and I wish we hadn't thought to "try something new" this time around.

title: Very disappointing stay….
text:
We planed  our anniversary in New York this year! Unfortunately we have to say that we are very disappointed with our hotel. No great food & beverage concept at all. The bar is next to the reception and if you expecting something nice in terms of food or beverage,this hotel is deff. the wrong hotel for you! Thanks god, the hotel is surrounded by restaurants…..  As a Bonvoy Titanium Platinuim member of Marriott, we most of the time treated a little bit different! Welcome card on the room, or even a bottle of water…. Nothing at all. I travel 110 nights in 2021 and this only with Marriott, and we also saw how vivid 19 changed the hotel industry, but what we experienced here is very disappointing.

Heavy service cut …..

We did not expect this kind of service reduction from a Renaissance Brand at all.

title: Best staff and rooms for nyc!
text:
Out of all the nyc hotels I have stayed at over the years this is one of the best! Staff is very friendly and treats you like a member of the family.  Great location just south of midtown but not too far from downtown and soho.  Rooms facing north have the best views but south is ok just not as pretty.  (Empire State is just north).

Breakfast is perfect each morning and small lounge for drinks with Tony at night is fun.  The managers Miriam, Cory, Umar and others provide a very high level of service.  The doorman and victor do an abasing job as well.  

Will definitely return!

title: Good location/why charge a resort fee?
text:
We recently stayed 2 nights at the renaissance Chelsea.  The hotel is confidently located 2 blocks from the subway.  The rooms were small, I have stayed in other NYC hotels with larger rooms.  We made due with the smaller room.  As other reviewers have noted the hotel gym is tiny and due to Covid only 3 guests at a time.  Wi-Fi worked well.  The hotel charges a resort fee (it was included on my reservation) but since there re no amenities, this is confusing,  I know the hotel is in to make a profit but if you need to charge a resort fee, provide some services (not Wi-Fi since that is a Marriott bonvoy status perk).  

If we visit NYC again, we might stay here again.

title: Great for a boutique hotel
text:
Good for a boutique hotel. I stayed here for 6 days for work and some pleasure.

The front guest services team were amazing. There was a billing issue where the wrong person was billed but they were able to be patient and supportive.

The rooms were painfully small but they were clean and welcoming. The bed and pillows were out of this world! Best sleep I’ve had in a while. 

The food at the restaurant located in the hotel was subpar. 

There’s this random rooftop lounge on top of the hotel which is always jam packed and so busy. You can never get in even if you stay at the hotel. 

I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again!

title: Really nice stay!
text:
After reading some previous reviews we almost cancelled but I'm very glad we decided to stay. Most of the negative reviews were noise related with the rooftop bar.  We requested to stay on any floor below the 30th floor and we had no problem with the noise.  Our room was on the 21st floor.
Our room was very clean with a wonderful view.  The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. Our king size bedroom had wonderful space and updated decor.  If you're wanting to stay in or near Chelsea, this is the place!  We didn't use the gym or eat at the restaurants but noticed people enjoying a nice bar area in the lobby.

title: Nice Hotel, Clean, Spacious Rooms, Gym with Peloton
text:
Nice hotel, first time here. Rooms are clean and spacious.  Nice location, lots to do around here. Staff have been a bit hiss and miss.  

Front desk super helpful, but getting into the restaurant for breakfast a little less so.  

All in all, very good and I will be back again.  All staff wearing masks and most guests.  

Gym is smaller that it looked online, a few treads and bikes, plus 1 peloton.

title: Great hotel, room for improvement
text:
Overall great hotel. 

Pros: staff was very friendly. Hotel is modern, clean, well located. Rooms are comfortable, albeit small with nice views. We had a city view room and unfortunately didn’t get a Marriott titanium suite upgrade. Didn’t eat at restaurant so can’t comment.

Cons: very poor at responding to requests made via app. We ordered extra towels and it consistently took several hours. My wife was cold one night so I messaged the desk asking about an extra blanket. They knocked on the door and woke us up at 3am (2hrs 45mjn later) with the blanket. Also, no fridge in room and only one ice machine in the hotel. Also, it’s 2021 and they still have drip coffee machine in room. Most hotels have gone to espresso machines and that would have been nice.

Overall good stay and nice hotel but they couldn’t definitely make it significantly better by improving on the above.

title: New property still working through things
text:
For two nights in October 2021, I settled into Room 402 at the Renaissance New York Chelsea.  This is a new property and my first time staying here.  I booked the two-night stay on the Marriott App, but when I arrived the front desk system only showed my stay as one night.  They looked up the reservation number I had been provided and were eventually able to find the reservation and adjust their system.  They also had the wrong nightly rate.  Both were corrected and they said their system was a little bit older and did not always sync well with Marriott’s system.  I thought it was odd that a new property would have an older system, but ultimately, they were able to quickly correct the information.
The decor of the hotel is a little bit on the modern side but with classic touches.  It was not overdone and overall appealing.  I read reviews that the nightclub caused lots of noise and could make it hard to sleep.  I think the club wasn’t in operation during my stay and overall found the property extremely quiet.  Being on the fourth floor, I expected some street noise but it was quiet, especially for New York standards.  The first morning at 7am I ventured to the concierge lounge for coffee.  When I returned to my room, the coffee was cold.  I mean cold, not even room temperature.   That was very disappointing as I didn’t want to make another track downstairs.  It was surprising as I was clearly one of the first guest of the day.  The coffee should have been freshly made and hot.  I called downstairs to make them aware hoping to save someone else from the same cup of cold coffee.  They offered to bring up a fresh cup, which I greatly appreciated.  However, when it arrived, it was cold too.  The second morning, I didn’t even attempt to get a cup of coffee on property.  I dined at the onsite restaurant, Cotto, for dinner on night two.  I had a question about the wine and the manager couldn’t provide much detail past what was written on the menu.  I choose a cabernet and it was nice.  I’d highly recommend the pappardelle al ragu.  The portion was more than enough.  It was flavorful.  While it was filling, it wasn’t heavy.  That evening had there been a restaurant of interest nearby I probably would have chosen other than the hotel restaurant but I’m glad I didn’t.
Room 402 is an accessible king.  It is appointed with king bed, a small desk and chair, sofa, side chair and coffee table. There is floor to ceiling windows looking out over 25th street allowing in tons of natural light.  There is both a sheer and blackout curtain that automatically will open and close with a slight pull of each.  Both the bed and sofa were comfortable.  There is a cabinet which provides a few doors for storage, a microwave, safe and houses the iron/ironing board.  Space to hang clothes is almost non-existent.  Maybe one or two items but not even worth bothering moving the items being stored in there to use.  There is also a large bar area to the left of the bed, offering counter space and a few drawers for storage. The in-room coffee/tea was Starbucks and Tazo/Bigelow.  I’d prefer if it were a Keurig as those seem more sanitary than the units which hold the water in a reservoir.  It looked clean and I hope it was given how new the property is but overtime, it could get pretty gross.  There is also a small bar sink and refrigerator in this area.  The bathroom was spacious but offered absolutely no counter space or shelving for toiletries.  That was maybe the most disappointing feature of the room.  The shampoo/conditioner brand was a generic.  I would have expected a little nicer option but not worth any fuss.  The one feature of the room which probably gets overlooked but actually makes the room pretty great is the very tall ceilings.  When most New York hotel rooms can feel cramped, the large ceilings and windows really made this room feel extremely spacious.    I actually booked this room for the balcony and paid more for it.  The weather turned out to be a little cooler than forecasted so I didn’t get to take advantage of the space as I was hoping to.  It is furnished with a small sofa, chair, coffee table, a few artificial plants and screens on both sides to provide privacy from the neighboring balconies.  As mentioned, the room overlooks 25th street.  Directly across the street are low rise buildings so the view expands beyond a couple blocks but certainly not the views that I saw in the online listing.  The balconies are not covered nor is there a heater so really only useful when the weather is nice, which for New York, is probably less than fifty percent of the time.  And hopefully, the neighboring balconies are respectful of the semi-private space.  In the end, I wouldn’t book the room again given the price point.
While it has been a couple of years since I was in the Chelsea area, it was not an area I would recommend for now.  Traveling alone, I didn’t feel as safe as I expected.  I walked the 9 blocks to Macy’s and overall it was fine, but definitely clutched my purse tight and was on guard.  The crowd is a mix of characters, some which made me feel concerned for my safety or at minimum, on high alert.  There were store fronts shut down and more grafetti than I saw in other parts of the city, such as Mid-Town.  Until New York fully returns to pre-pandemic crowds, I think I would choose another part of the city for my next stay.

title: Terrible Management/ people with disabilities beware
text: The worst part of our trip was dealing with the elevators.   There are only four and on a good day they are slow.     On Saturday afternoon at least one elevator broke - - management never put up signage warning people, but we tried to use it and figured it out on our own.  On Sunday when we tried to get downstairs we waited over 30 minutes for an elevator.  We saw people were walking down the stairs.  My husband who has heart issues and difficulty walking any distance was forced to walk down 12 flights of stairs with his luggage so that we could make out train.  No employees in sight to help.  No signs.  No warning.  When we got to the front desk the clerk laughed a little when I told her what had happened.  When I asked her if the situation amused her she did not apologize and merely stated two elevators were out and the engineers had been called (at least one elevator had been out for over 12 hours).   On a different note, the water in the shower was lukewarm at best and would revert to ice cold at times.  So unpleasant we each only used it once over the whole weekend.   Very bad experience!!!

title: Expected better customer service
text:
This was my first time staying at this hotel. Rooms here are standard NYC sized (read: small), which is fine for me. The bed was very comfortable, but I found the closet space (less than 1ft of hanging space + 1 drawer) a bit challenging. 

Throughout the week, my room was not made up twice while I was away for the day (I was out of the room 9am to 10pm each day, and there was no do not disturb sign up either time). The first time it happened, I called the desk and the concierge apologized and offered to send towels. Unfortunately, it took over an hour for those fresh towels to arrive, so I didn’t bother asking the second time it happened. I also never received my welcome gift during the week, which I normally get as an elite member. 

There is also a strange dynamic between guests for the rooftop bar and guests of the hotel, where the former get priority over the elevator use. On several occasions, I had to wait well over 10 minutes to get in an elevator to go up to my room because any available elevator would be used for the bar guests.

What was most disappointing was at checkout, when I reiterated the challenges I had during my stay, the staff member just commented “that’s strange”. I don’t know what I was expecting, but I felt disappointed with how my feedback was handled. 

The only silver lining for this stay was that there was a room available for my early check-in at 12 when I arrived. However overall, I felt the experience was disappointing for the $ spent. I travel to NYC for work frequently and am not sure I will return again for future stays, despite it being my only option for Marriott hotels nearby. 

—-
One other note if indoor masking matters to you - little to no members of the staff wear masks indoors, and neither do most of the guests. I’m not sure what the rules are in NYC since I was just visiting, but sharing in case this is helpful info to someone else.

title: Clean hotel,  good service and a great vibe!
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance Chelsea Hotel last week for a work meeting.  I loved it!  The hotel is new, so the lobby and rooms are updated with great decor.  The front desk staff was courteous and my room was SPOTLESS.  I had both breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant and was very pleased.  Our meeting room was on the 36th floor and the views were spectacular!  I was there with 8 other people from work and we all agreed that the stay was ideal- great location, great food, awesome views and a great vibe!  I highly recommend staying here and I look forward to returning in the near future.

NMK

title: Great Hotel!
text:
Tremendously kind and courteous staff.  Picturesque views of seemingly all of Manhattan, north of 25th St. Also really appreciated the room decor.  Not something I would normally notice, but it's the perfect blend of trendy, yet comfortable and homey.  Can't wait to return.  

PS: Delicious craft cocktails at the lobby bar

title: All night music!!!
text: Always stay at Marriott’s but this was very disappointing. The Roof top pool and bar is not available to guest it requires a reservation and fee. Also on the 38th floor they have a night club “somewhere nowhere” that plays loud thumping music from 10pm till 4am…YES!! 4:00am. That also is not accessible to guests and they even take half the elevators at night. Other than that it’s a beautiful hotel with amazing views!! Maybe they are catering to the under 30 crowd (??)

title: Not for sleep before 4am
text: The hotel is ok BUT there is no getting sleep here. The nightclub on the roof has kept us up every night. It’s currently 1:30am and two white noise apps on our phones can’t even drown out the thumping.  When you return to the hotel late at night you are greeted by drunken nightclub crowds in front of the hotel and in the lobby. The free breakfast for elite members is also abysmal.  We gave up and walked down the street every day to get breakfast. The people that work at this Marriott are very kind, but we would never return because of the loud thumping music. I can sleep through most things but this is excessive.

title: Will be back
text: This hotel was opened just before the pandemic and was closed for several months until it reopened again. So basically it’s a new hotel . The room we got was not too spacious but modern and very clean. Service at front desk was very friendly . They don’t have a bellboy or concierge - which is a hit if a disadvantage.

title: The Suite Life - Not
text:
This is a cautionary tale for those Marriott road warriors who are Platinum or Lifetime Titanium like myself.

For the first time since they have been offered, I decided to take advantage of the Suite Night upgrade that is offered once a year to Elite's. Not having used it before, I read the instructions carefully and made the request several weeks before my trip. Imagine my surprise when I received an email four days before arrival that an upgrade to a suite had been confirmed! This five day trip to the Renaissance was a very special one for my wife and myself and I didn't let on that we were going to be staying in style. Once the confirmation email arrived I looked at the hotel website to see what the suites looked like and was in awe, wondering which one we would be assigned.

We arrived at the brand spanking new Renaissance Chelsea and was immediately impressed with the property. After a quick check-in we went up to the room and I opened the door, anticipating my wife's excitement. Then it happened.. it was an ordinary, small New York City hotel room, and then I had to spill the beans to my wife that it was supposed to be a suite. Knowing that I had the suite upgrade confirmation with me, we went back down to report that we were given the wrong room. But as it turned out, it was anything but a mistake. I politely spoke to the person who checked me in and without a flinch she sought the help of the desk manager. After some fancy keyboard work the manager said that there weren't any suites available and that at this property a suite upgrade isn't really an upgrade to a suite but a one room level upgrade, you know, the kind that Elite's are supposed to be given if available. I'm a type "M" personality (mellow) and didn't raise my voice or give her a hard time, but I did try to stand my ground. In the end she wore me out as I tucked my tail up between my legs and walked away, totally defeated, seething and worst of all - feeling slighted. I wasn't even offered a goodwill gesture like a bottle of wine, the attitude being that I was granted an upgrade from a 225 square foot room to a 226 square foot room and that I should be thankful for having received even that.

According to the Marriott site, I have stayed at Marriott's a total of 1,760 nights over the years, and that doesn't include stays which were in my wife's name, so I would venture to guess that's it's more like 2,100 nights. I have been to hundreds of Marriott's worldwide, from Australia to Zurich and have never been more disappointed and felt dejected as I did last week. 

I will follow up with my assessment of this property.

title: Wonderful visit
text: We stayed here for two nights and had a wonderful time. The location is terrific And centrally located for getting around New York City. The room  was Very comfortable and immaculate.  The view From the room ,of New York City ,was spectacular. The staff was very friendly and professional. We will be back!

title: Phenomenal Hotel
text: I do not usually write reviews but I felt it necessary to write a review for this hotel after our stay. The renaissance was beyond clean and sanitized. We felt safe during Covid staying here. The staff was very accommodating especially the men/women that kept the rooms and common areas clean. They were courteous and followed all protocols that seem to be in place for NY. Our room was always cleaned when asked and we saw staff wiping things down and cleaning throughout our stay to keep all of the guests safe. I would highly recommend staying at the Renaissance in Chelsea if you plan on visiting NYC. Not only was the hotel very clean, but the entire staff was friendly, accommodating and courteous, the views are picturesque and the location was perfect for anyone traveling. Thank you Renaissance for a wonderful stay, you made our stay in NYC that much more pleasurable.

title: Fun Getaway
text: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Chelsea on a recent Saturday night.  Great central location near trains and subways making it easy to get to a friend's birthday dinner.  Loved the lobby with a cool bar for a night cap.  We were on the 36th floor with great views of downtown. Room was clean and décor was modern.  I had read some reviews on noise from the club, but we didn't have any noise issues and slept well.  Would stay here again.

title: Looks were certainly deceiving
text:
Modern decor and centrally located. But if you care about cleanness, you might think twice about staying at the Renaissance NYC Chelsea hotel. I suspect the Marriott is understaffed or unwilling to pay for staff with hotel management and hotel housekeeping experience. Housekeeping is practically nonexistent at the Renaissance. Yes, kudos on the chic club vibe the hotel is going for. I prefer to sleep in clean sheets and not find the previous guest(s) hair all over the bathroom floor and shower. And I don't mean a strand of hair, here and there. I mean balls of hair! The shower didn't drain. There were water (or urine?) stains on the floor around the toilet.  The sheets looked clean at first glance. On the 3rd (and last) night of my stay, I noticed housekeeping made the bed but left all sorts of lint and trash that I left on the bed that morning. I then wondered, if they failed to shake the bed cover and remove trash off the bed, yet the bed is made, what else are they not removing. I removed the bed covers to find dark stains (fluid stains) on the sheets by the foot of the bed. I had been sleeping on dirty sheets my whole stay!!
Yes, I reported it all to front desk management twice. There weren't rooms available. I suggested to the front desk manager to send in housekeeping to clean my room while I was out. At the very least, vacuum and clean the bathroom floor and shower. That never happened. BTW, upon checking in, front desk will charge your credit card $25 per person per night. Mind you this "resort" fee was not disclosed in the reservation. The hotel justifies the daily $25 fee by offering a hotel credit in the same amount that you can redeem for breakfast at the hotel restaurant or drinks at the hotel bar.

Housekeeping staff did not wear masks. It is so irresponsible for the hotel to not take proper health and  cleaning measures in the middle of a pandemic.

title: Super Loud Hotel!
text:
It’s a hotel with roof top night club located at the very top floor. I checked in Saturday 11pm, got inside my room on the 33 floor, showered and could not go to sleep because of a loud music bang noise from the club upstairs! Had to wait until 4am to finally get some sleep. Next day, requested for a room change, luckily they’re willing to put me on a lower level to the 27th floor.. but still, a bang noise from the club… 
(Not as loud as before but you can still a techno style music in your room) 

If you’re traveling and looking for a peaceful place for a good rest.. you’re in the wrong place, but if you’re here for just a night for fun, a room to crash after a heavy night in the club, then this place is for you. 

Such a waste of money and time, expected a nice and comfy rest which Renaissance Chelsea could not provide.

title: Good service, small room
text: Staff very helpful and pleasant. Very responsive. Room was small hence only 4 stars. High floor wasn’t too noisy. Gym was ok - lots of cardio and free weights but no machines. They have a Peloton bike. Decor is nice throughout. Area seems ok regarding safety

title: Nice hotel in a bit of an odd location
text: Overall great stay at the hotel - the staff were super friendly and accommodating (which you don't always get in NYC).  There is a nightclub somewhere in the hotel, but we were high enough that we didn't hear anything from it (just the velvet rope and the one blocked elevator).  The hotel is on a bit of a shabby block going toward 7th Ave (stay on the side of the road as the hotel and you will be better off) but the 6th Ave side was fine (and closer) with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.  A bit pricey but you also expect that from NYC.  We did have breakfast at the hotel and the quality was good though again a little spendy vs. what you could get just outside.  Also used the workout room which was decent sized (and gave a chance for some social distancing due to the pandemic).

title: Not coming back.
text: I will not chose this hotel again. I had a short list of three hotels in NYC. The three of them with a roof or a terrace. After we arrived here they told us that the terrace on the pictures where not part of the hotel so guests are not able to enjoy it. Like showing a swimming pool from another neighborhood. I think it is totally misleading as I would not have chosen this hotel having known that. BTW there is no refrigerator in the room. Next time I might need to ask if there is hot water in the shower.

title: Amazing!
text:
We stayed here for my husband’s birthday. Chris and his team were so gracious and accommodating. Our huge suite was absolutely gorgeous with a large terrace overlooking 25th street. Central location close to everything! We didn’t get a chance to try the bar or restaurant, but it looked great. This hotel will be my new go-to for all future business and personal trips to the city.

My only hope is that hotel guests will be given special privilege/access to the rooftop bar in the future.

title: Great hotel!
text:
After reading some of the reviews here I was hesitant to book this hotel.  I was traveling with children and I was concerned about the club on the roof of the hotel. We were there during the week and had a room on a lower floor so the club was no problem at all.  In fact, the hotel turned out to be great.  It is in a central location so it’s easy to go anywhere around the city.  The decor was haunted mansion chic in the best possible way.   Plus there were swinging chairs in the lobby that my kids loved.  Waters were provided at the front desk all throughout the day which was great on a hot summer day.  We also ate at the restaurant for dinner one night and that was pretty good, not great, but pretty good.  It even had good options for kids. In addition, everyone at the front desk was super helpful. 

My only complaints are that the hotel is advertised as having a pool, it does not.  The pool is run by a third party and while adults can make a reservation, it is not generally available to hotel guests. 

In addition, if you are eligible for the complimentary breakfast as a Marriott Bonvoy member, you are not seated in the dining room.  You are seated in a weird little room off the buffet area.  There was a leak in the ceiling, construction going on behind a wall, and uncomfortable seating. But these were minor issues, and overall we had a wonderful stay.

title: EXCELLENT Hotel Experience - MUST STAY
text: I'm a native New Yorker and have lived in Manhattan for 20 years.  Needed a night  away from the kids so my wife and I booked a room here.  I've seen the best and worst of the NYC hotel experience - and this place is top notch.  Beautiful building, overly attentive and welcoming/friendly staff, solid lobby hotel bar, VERY clean rooms, great views, and a fair price.  Also centrally located in the city making it easy to get everywhere.  It's really everything you want in a New York City hotel.  We all know some NYC hotels can totally suck.  You're in great hands here.

title: NYC  Chelsea Experience. Great location for walking the city but the neighborhood is a bit gritty.
text: Mariam, a manager, and Tony, the lobby bartender pushed this review to four stars. They were so friendly and worked really hard to make you feel like a valued guest. Pros:  great staff, decent fitness center, very clean. Cons:  extremely small rooms, noisy at night because of Club on top floor.

title: No vengan a este hotel. Las fotos mienten
text: Un espanto! Las habitaciones no solo son pequeñas sino que no tienen el mínimo c confort. No limpiaron nuestra habitación y por ello nos “compensaron” con un desayuno buffet que es el más feo que probé en mi vida. En la habitación córner con vistas te chocas contra las paredes. En las fotos muestran una piscina de dicen que no pertenece al hotel. Todas las noches hay fiesta en la terraza con un ambiente desagradable que perjudica a los huéspedes. No vengan a este hotel!

title: Do not stay here!! Insanely loud nightclub
text: We had a horrible stay here last weekend. There is very loud rooftop club and music is blaring into the rooms. There are crowds of people outside the club making it joke around the hotel. Do not stay here. They claim the rooftop is not affiliated with the hotel but it’s out of control.

title: Great Visit
text: Great location. Beautiful room. Awesome views. The staff was super accommodating. Cory at the front desk was very nice  and Victor was fabulous. No doubt  this will be my new homebase every time I visit New York City.

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
The Renaissance in Chelsea is my new favorite hotel in NYC!

Everything about this hotel is perfect. This hotel is in Chelsea, but it is very close to Midtown and Madison Square Garden, and walkable to Times Square. The location is excellent and close to trains, convenience stores, restaurants, shops, and so much more. The lobby is classy and elegant, and the front desk staff really made my trip special through their kindness and recognition of my Marriott status. The room was really well-appointed, and I loved the nightlight design in the bathroom. I had a room on the 30th floor, and the view was excellent – a view of Chelsea, Midtown, and the top of the Empire State Building. I really loved the tasteful decor throughout the hotel. 

I didn’t get a chance to visit the restaurant or the rooftop but the rooftop club seemed to be a popular destination on the Friday night when I stayed here. I had a great time in the Chelsea neighborhood during my stay- LOVE the area!

Thank you to the front desk staff who helped me when I arrived. I will be back. Truly an outstanding stay in July 2021.

title: Too many shortcomings
text: This hotel is not what it appears.  From the outside, its a Renaissance, newly built slightly over 1 year ago, with upgraded finishes.  When you check-in, you realize there is no restaurant and no room service due to Covid.  You can't even get a coffee in the lobby.  The rooms are small, even for NYC standards.  The Aveda toiletries advertised are gone and replaced by another brand you've never heard of that is an inferior quality.  The walls are thin to the point where you can hear conversations in the adjoining rooms.  While the bathroom is slightly above average it also lacks the ability for someone to put on makeup directly in front of a mirror with good lighting.  Also, and its not the hotel's doing, but the homeless encamped on the sidewalk is unsightly but harmless, at least in our experience.  Lastly, like other posters have commented, our AC unit struggled to keep the temperature cool.  It was humid when visiting and our clothes, while hung in the room, became damp as the AC wasn't able to cool the room.

title: Nice new hotel, but loud
text:
Overall we had an okay stay here. The rooms are small but brand new and with great decor. Bed was comfortable, showers are nice. Our bathroom door did not close properly, and a maintenance worker was unable to fix it, but not a huge issue. We asked for a high floor as I am a light sleeper and we wanted to avoid noise. We got a room on the 34th floor, thinking we’d be far from street noise. Unbeknownst to us when booking, a rooftop club opened the weekend of our stay on the top two floors of the hotel. Hotel guests have no special privileges or access to the rooftop club or pool—we were just told you have to get your own reservation separately. Very strange for a higher end hotel to offer no benefits to guests or help with access. Also, these were advertised as amenities for the hotel and are absolutely not.

The real problem started our second night—Saturday night, we arrived home to go to bed to find a massive crowd around the hotel of people trying to get into the rooftop club. No issue, we went around them and up to the room. Except we could hear loud bass through the walls/ceiling from the club FIVE floors up and music through the window. This noise went on until FOUR IN THE MORNING. And was audible over the earplugs and sound machine we brought. We called the front desk about the music, and they said no one else complained and the club was closed. A lie. After another call at 4am with the music still going, the front desk said they were wrapping things up upstairs.  

The next morning, we requested to be moved to a lower floor away from the club. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating and we had great service. However, they said no one else had complained, but we met a women in the elevator saying she had also complained and could hear the music on the 35th floor. We did not hear music on the lower floor after moving rooms, but not sure if it was because the club closed earlier that night (Sunday).

Overall, the noise issue was ridiculous. We wish we had been informed of a 4am club and poor soundproofing when we were put on the 34th floor and had specifically requested a quiet room. Were it not for this problem, I would have given this place 5 stars. They seriously need to sort out the noise problem. Definitely do not stay anywhere near the rooftop club on a weekend.

title: Fine hotel on a quiet block
text: Fine stay at this clean and comfortable hotel.  The location is quiet, even on a lower floor (we were on the 9th) we had minimal street noise. The staff has that predictable NYC attitude. Lots of leaning and avoiding eye contact and when you ask a direct question it seems like a lot of effort to answer you.

title: Poor customer service
text:
When we checked in we were asked about housekeeping, and if we wanted to schedule for housekeeping services. We said yes and scheduled for 12PM the next day.

It’s the next day and no one cleaned our room. I asked the front desk guy, he tells me there was no such service scheduled. He then went on to tell me the guy who checked us in was new, and that he has been there a week… why do i care? And why are you telling me that? Learn customer service and find solutions and don’t throw your own staff under the bus. We requested for fresh towels… guess what? We didn’t get them when we returned. 

We returned and i called front desk again for towels and the front desk was ready to run me the same story from earlier. 

You can’t even get housekeeping right after COVID?!?! Come on.

title: Tiny room, the worst service!
text: This might have been the smallest hotel room in a city known for tiny hotel rooms. It barely fit both mine and my girlfriends suitcases and we had climb over them anytime we wanted to got in our out of bed/the bathroom/enter or leave the room. But the worst part, you apparently have to request maid service 24hrs in advance, and they DO NOT TELL YOU THIS! It is very sad because this hotel is conveniently placed next to my new office and I will never stay here again.

title: an Average Renaissance
text:
Good: Location was perfect for a foodie, close to the metro. Furnishings felt modern, decent sized gym, and the price for a "nice" hotel in Manhattan was more than reasonable.

Bad: The Service. It wasn't bad, it was just absent, which for a hotel like this seemed bad. I've stayed at a lot of marriotts and it just seemed odd. Also, with the rooftop bar and pool closed it felt like more of a soft-opening than a fully-fledged hotel. 

Ugly: Nothing. But if this wasn't a new hotel it would probably be a 3/5.

title: Nice view, kind of lackluster experience.
text:
There's quite a bit to say, so I'm just going to itemize them for the folks looking for info.

- Very small rooms, no fridge by default. Little room for suitcases even!
- No fan in the bathroom. 
- At least in room 3507, the mirror in the room is perfectly placed to see from the toilet to the bed, lmao.
- Shower products are good, but the bar soaps are TINY
- Not enough towels for 2 by default, and the body towels are again tiny.
- Bed was very comfortable, actually.  View from 3507 was amazing.  
- Rooftop bar and pool is still closed. Restaurant downstairs is still closed.
- TV supports a good number of streaming services, nice perk.
- Alarm was set for 6:00am either automatically or by the previous stay. Always check the alarm clock. 😴

title: Family weekend
text: We had a great stay here for a quick family weekend in the city. The staff was friendly, accommodating and welcoming. The rooms were very clean and the views were great! The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the city! We were with children ages 3-7 who all had a great time.

title: Hotel not capable of managing Covid restrictions while upholding basic standards of service and is not ready.
text:
Horrified to find a dump in our bathroom toilet as we checked in. Carpets were filthy. The hotel cut back on staff services like cleaning because of Covid but is now profiting from that by making no effort to get back to normal. I guess they like the lower labour costs too much. The restaraunt is still closed when most of NY is back open. 
We prepaid for the room and I have been charged (without any notification $297.00) It is impossible to reach to anyone at the hotel because of phone system. Holding for 30 minutes, who can do that? Essentially customers are an inconvenience to this organisation and any opportunity to cut back on customer service has been taken resulting in a very alienating guest experience. I feel for any organisation trying to get back on their feet after the pandemic but this hotel is not ready and should not be open. It's a terrible thing to promise a service and then treat your customers with contempt. Splash out a little more on a hotel that will at least provide you with decent hospitality.

title: Buena ubicación y lindo hotel.
text: Excelente ubicación, en la cuadra del lado tienes un citi Bike lo que era muy conveniente pues decidimos no tomar metro ni tren sino recorrer ny en bici. Tiene las estaciones muy cercanas. Café y súper al lado del hotel. Adicional muy lindo habiataciones cómodas y de buen tamaño.

title: Great experience!
text:
Always looking for a good hotel to stay in NYC, I decided to try the Renaissance New York Chelsea Hotel. As a Marriott Titanium member, I contacted the property in advance with some questions and requests, and was delighted with the warm professionalism of Assistant General Manager Matt Cerabona. When I arrived at the property, Lucy at the front desk provided a wonderful welcome. I had reserved three rooms for a combination of a work and family trip. 

The location of this property is great, and the views of the cityscape and Empire State building breathtaking. The hotel is not yet functioning with food service due to the pandemic, but there are many options close by. Will return!

title: Poor communication from front desk
text:
Clean hotel, spacious rooms for NYC, and convenient location. 

Took away stars because they didn't let us know upon check-in that we had to link our Marriot Bonvoy account to get free wifi. We followed the instructions when connecting to the wifi network and signed in with our Marriot Bonvoy account info but we still got charged for 2 nights of wifi usage. I had to call and follow up about the charges since they didn't provide an itemized receipt when we checked-out. They also refused to refund those charges since we completed our stay, but there was no way to review the charges since they did not provide a receipt.

Won't be staying here again due to their lack of communication from the front desk.

title: Friendly Service, Peaceful Stay!
text: Had a great experience, check in was great Lucy explained all the hotels amenities, and policy's. Lucy was very courteous and displayed excellent customer service. I wish the room was a little bigger but overall I enjoyed my stay and the friendly customer service. I forgot to mention, the bed is super comfortable, I fell asleep instantly felt like I was sleeping on clouds lol.  I would definitely recommend and would book again. :)

title: Fantastic Newcomer to the scene
text: I am a very frequent traveler and spend about 2 months per year in and out of NYC....so I have tried many of the hotels.  This newish Renaissance checks all my boxes.  Great front desk staff (if your nice, some guests are deplorable), an Excellent General Manager, Chris and its a new property well kitted out.  It's location cannot be beat, blocks from Fashion institute of Technology, Macy's, Chelsea, over 100 restaurants and bars.  Pre-Covid rates were around $275-$375 +tax and fees per night....so anyone staying today is on a half price sale if you book smartly.  Coffee shops on both corners as well as a strong creative, gay and homeless population all living together in that "Flower district", this is a great NYC edgy Neighborhood and one I would even consider living in.   Rooms tends to be rather small as most are 230 square feet but they are perfectly planned and the beds are super comfy as are the linens.   Lobby Bar and Restaurant is due to open soon and the roof top pool with a spectacular Empire state view I was told is opening around Memorial day.   During my 7 day stay, I asked for housekeeping services every day and they came 7 days....some days they were more thorough then others, but during covid, you must be realistic.  Even 7 days cleaning is far better then most hotels around.....  There are only 5 suites out of 341 rooms so if you want one, book it.  Even if you are the Marriott king.....There is no upgrading to those suites.....People are paying full wack and hotels are indeed a business where $$ talks.   Currently bottled water at the front desk.  They actually helped with my vast luggage which was greatly appreciated, as I said, lovely staff.   I left because I had friends coming in to another hotel which was indeed less $ but cannot compare...While its been fun, I look back at my time in the Renaissance Chelsea with much fondness and I will return soon.   There are some great rates out there, so look around.  Please don't steal the sheets.....ooh yes,  with lower rates they are getting some players who are outrageous guests and you can see them if you sit in the lobby and work for a while with your ears open......   You are also allowed to order in food to the lobby to eat if you wish and avoid the strong smell of dinner "lingering" in your room.    They have really made the best of what they have, given the circumstances.  Stay healthy and I wish Safe Travels to all.  Cheers!

title: Excellent
text:
The Renaissance Chelsea is a great addition to the downtown hotel scene, filling a gap that existed for a high-end hotel in Chelsea.

I stayed for 5 nights earlier this month.  The hotel is doing a very good job operating in a covid world.  Understandably, not all hotel services were available, but essential services such as housekeeping were available. 

I am looking forward to returning to the Renaissance Chelsea.  As New York continues to open up, I look forward to enjoying the hotel fully, with all services restored.

For now, my commendations to the management and staff.  You are doing a great job.

title: Great upscale hotel
text: Very nice hotel in a peaceful neighborhood. Staff very friendly and helpful, and rooms were clean and comfortable, especially the beds. We also enjoyed the city view from our room. I booked on expedia and for extra twenty bucks I was able to add free parking. By the front desk they handed me the free ticket, the garage was only a block away, so parking was quick and easy, no hassle. The reason I took off one star is the fact that it's impossible to contact the hotel thru their number, this was very frustrating for me.

title: Real issues pertaining to cleaning room
text:
I stayed there from 4/9-12 like room cleaned 4/10&11
One day they cleaned it then other day they just put towels in the bathroom and that’s it

They did not have stickers that you should break to ensure cleanliness 

No valet and yet the parking lot still cost 54.00 a day

It is new and the room is small but very well organized 
Also wow terrible toiletries

Boy are they cheap they do not even replace it when they clean the room

Very disappointed 

Will not stay there again

title: Wouldn’t go right now.
text: This hotel was very disappointing.   They have a pretty roof top space they use in all their advertising but are keeping it closed. For no reason other than too lazy to staff for it for hour at sunset or evening.   That could easily be done for an hour so guests could use it for pictures.    It’s an outdoor space!   If you can be in their elevator, you should be able to be on the roof looking at the Empire State Building.   The homeless situation on the street next to the hotel is a real problem.   A large group of homeless are next to the hotel and another across the street under street scaffolding that makes it very dark when walking back from restaurants at night and uncomfortable.    The rooms have carpeting and I got a few bites on my feet.   (Bugs of some sort).    They are not cleaning rooms during your stay.   Also did not upgrade our floor despite being very empty.   We were left to look over the Goodwill  Store and the homeless.    So that was just petty adherence to the  Marriott paid rate unless they are only keeping a few floors open to  not hire more staff back.   The front desk crew was nice and decor nice as in the adverts but location is good if you want to use subway two blocks away, but otherwise a bit far from high line and better restaurants in Chelsea.

title: Great location
text: Cute hotel, clean and followed all protocols.  The lobby is available if you prefer delivery/takeout.  Great location! We walked everywhere- Moma, NYU, meat packing district, Times Square! I’d love to come back when the rooftop is open.

title: A cute little escape
text:
I live in a house and needed to "get away" since I'm still working from home.  I got a nice rate on hotel tonight and stayed at the Renaissance Chelsea for just one night.  The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating.  Covid protocols were being followed and anyone we saw had a mask on and it was very easy yo be socially distant because I barely saw anyone.  

The rooms are cute, cozy, and clean.  I was impressed it is decorated really well and felt like an actual bedroom as opposed to a standard hotel room.  I also love the hallway decor- it's lovely and a nice surprise.  

We had a drink in the outdoor heated space- nobody else was there and the bartender was friendly.  We just took it out there ourselves there isn't any service.  I can't remember where we got food from but we brought it back to the hotel and ate outside at the time NYC was still not open for indoor dining.  

Everything was just really cozy, mellow and easy which was what I needed.

title: Wonderful New Property
text:
I had a great stay here earlier this month. Prior to check-in I reached out to management to see if they had any rooms with a bathtub due to a surgery I had scheduled. The GM, Chris, was quick to reach back out and block me one of their accessible rooms and clearly had taken note of my preference for a high floor as well which is appreciated as a Titanium Elite. 

Matt at the desk really stood out over the course of my four nights on the property. He was always on it in remembering my name and made a point to check-in on me following the procedure. He had a great recommendation for lunch that was truly tailored to what I was asking for with all the restrictions I was given post-op. 

Minor issues like missing remotes and a broken chair were addressed reasonably fast. It seemed like the property was trying to work through some bad furniture that they got delivered for their opening still as even the replacements were still a little wonky. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the desk is a lot better than what other new properties are trying to pass off as a workspace. Pro Tip:  Book of Mormon makes a nice mousepad since the laser doesn’t do well with the glass. Internet was fast and reliable. TV was updated with all the streaming services like Netflix and YouTube to give you plenty to do if you must stay in the room. 

Rates were reasonable and due to current events points were offered in lieu of food and beverage and the destination fee was waived due to the restrictions in place. I believe the bar re-opened during my stay but I had enough pain meds that I didn’t need to add any booze to the mix ;-). 

I’d gladly return again in the future and am watching the rates daily in case a good deal comes back around like last time! Thanks!

title: Great stay again, good hotel and staff.
text:
Another great stay at this property, it is located right in the heart of Chelsea and a bit quieter road.  The hotel staff always welcome you back and even in a pandemic still have that smile feeling under the mask.  Matt at the front desk is awesome, he is always happy to help and a stellar person.  

The hotel is newer and has a newer feel for sure.  The gym (like most NY gyms) is on the smaller side but they have what you need including a Peleton bike!  The rooms are new, functional, and have what you need - they can be on the smaller side so book a larger one if more space is needed.

Thank you again for a great stay team!

title: New Hotel
text: One night SAT before xmas, booked a regular room and used a SNA to get corner room 3101.  TA reviewers correct rooms are NYC sized.  Room clean, no fridge but you can ask for one, I requested extra towels and toiletries in the Marriott App and IT WORKED!! See pics.  Ice on same floor as gym and must keep keycard with you for elevators.  Still no lounge or free breakfasts back yet for platinum but did not get charged any destination fees.  Go next door Pisillos for heros at lunch and get breakfast at Johnny Luncheonette the next morning.  Had nice stay.

title: Excellent
text:
I spent five nights here at the end of November- strongly recommended.   Property is new, with a solid balance between design and function.   Staff were great, with particular nods to Matt, for whom all requests were easy and positively received, and Aretha, whose smile lights up the night shift.   

I stayed in a balcony suite.  If you have to quarantine in a hotel in NYC due to state entry regulations, this is your place.  Lots of space, indoors and out.  Loved it and plan to return.   

Looking forward to visiting post pandemic when the rooftop bar and pool are open again

title: Amazing location, fantastic hotel close to the Empire State
text:
Second time at the Renaissance and we would definitely go again to the property. 
Lobby is comfy modern, front desk folks very helpful as usual. Room is New York small but very functional. Icing on the cake, we got a room on the 33rd floor, with a direct view on the Empire State. Falling asleep watching the Empire State, is quite an experience. Penn Station is 10 mins walking distance only for those coming from Newark Airport.

title: New favorite New York Hotel
text:
We visit New York at least once a year and have stayed at many different properties in various locations within the city.  This Chelsea area turned out to one of our favorite. You are in the center of everything you want to do.  Easy access to Downtown, Midtown, Times Square and all the shopping areas. There are 3 subway lines within a couple of blocks. Yes there are some homeless around due to a covered walkway at a construction site next door.  That will improve over time. 

The hotel itself was nicely done. A small boutique style gives it character and a welcoming feeling.  Unlike the large hotels you don’t feel rushed or crowded.  There is a small intimate lobby bar that was a comfortable place to socialize.  As a Marriott Platinum we were able to get upgraded to a suite. Actually, more like an apartment. Incredible room.  We had my son and daughter-in-law with us so the extra space was great for getting together. 

Finally the staff.  Every encounter we had with the staff was excellent.  They took care of any request we made. It is obvious that they care about their property.  Also the General Manager, Chris, went out of his way to modify our reservations when we had to make a quick last-minute modification. You know he takes pride in his property  when you see his email listed in his remarks. You do not see that often in these reviews. 

This is our new favorite hotel and will return.

title: Fantastic Hotel even during these times, Great Location!
text:
Great new hotel in Chelsea, the location was just stellar!  It is so close to great food and beverage, the road it is on is easy for Uber drivers to stop and drop off (That isn't always the case in NY) 

The hotel is brand new and it shows, the room was clean and smelled new.  They are on the smaller side as NY hotels tend to be, but the layout is great and great design in the bathrooms.  

Hotel is doing the best they can with the restrictions in the city, gym was open (Limited capacity) and the time I was there the bar has just opened back up which was great!  Great patio seating outside to have a drink and watch the city go by.  

Most hotels in NY are getting used to what can and cannot be open.  More and more seems to be opening at the property making things feel a little more normal again.

title: Neighborhood Treasure restored
text:
What a wonderful place to stay! 
The elegant entryway, leads you to a large airy lobby – – seating area and check-in desk to the left, a beautiful bar with cozy seating areas unfortunately under utilized during these Covid times on the right. Matt greeted us with a cheerful welcome, Introducing us to the establishment with a brief history colored with his own personal perspective – – he then graciously entertained the barrage of questions posed then to him about the place with pride and detail. Cudos to Matt!!
Turns out this hotel sits on the old Chelsea flea market lot, the decor throughout the place playing homage to this detail. Simple, interesting, artistic… Just a lot of fun. We could’ve spent hours in the main staircase alone looking at all the antique odds and ends garnishing the walls. 
All the electronic conveniences of modern age accompanied the elevators, the wall info units, etc. adding utility to the otherwise spotless Corridors and rooms. Funky stuff intermingled— rows of old leather belts papered the elevators. Very cool
The rooms likewise had eclectic decorations and the pure white linens and the comfy beds with featherbeds a-top were much appreciated. The bathroom was spic-n-span clean with a large modern shower made even better by the hot water with strong water pressure.
Gorgeous well-equipped gym in the basement was just an added bonus, with a beautiful pool on the very top/roof of the restaurant — seen only by picture, never really got up there. 
Extremely economical, usually with valet parking but put on hold by Covid. Would go back in a heartbeat

title: Beautiful Property and Views! Best Rooftop views in the city!
text:
We stayed this past weekend for two nights at the Renaissance Chelsea hotel (during covid for those that is relevant to) and were very happy.
The property is absolutely gorgeous in style and decor, it is very clean and welcoming as well. Sadly, with covid, restaurants are closed at the property and of course you must wear your mask in all common areas.
The rooms are a great size for the city (without paying an arm and a leg) and it had a beautiful view. We reserved a Corner King View room and were granted an upgraded floor the day prior due to a special occasion. Unfortunately, the room was taken by another guest upon our arrival; however, we were placed on the 23rd floor with a corner view and the gentleman working that evening graciously discounted our rate a bit due to the inconvenience. 
Valet didn't seem to be an option during our stay there, we arrived in the middle of the night and valet typically doesn't run that late anyhow; however, I saw none during the day either. We didn't have much trouble finding parking on the street the hotel is on though - or one street over, no biggie. 
We had no trouble with customer service, requested towels a few times, tooth brushes, laundry bags, etc. all were met with happy tones and immediate deliveries.
We walked from the hotel to Times Square and back, it's a good walk - but a beautiful one. There are tons of restaurants within a few block radius - highly recommend 2 Bros Pizza on the corner, as well as The Smith a few blocks up. Lots of local shopping nearby as well!

title: Mediocre at best
text: I do not recommend this hotel. Unprofessional inattentive staff, zero amenities available (no room service, not hotel restaurant, no mini fridge). There are sketchy people that were always hanging out in front of the building and all up and down the street it is on. It was very off putting.

title: Great disappointment, poor customer service
text: I'm a disabled veteran who was in the need of get away,  looking online, I found this hotel which is a new hotel in my city, with a striking view. To my chagrin I was met with a rude assistant manager (posing as the general manager ) who informed me that I couldn't have a late checkout, even after notifying  him in ample time that I was staying an additional night, in a upgraded room! After speaking to the  General Manager Chris who heard my grievance and assured me he would get to the bottom of it. I then canceled room and booked at Renaissance Midtown which superseded my expectations.

title: Great service
text: Great visit at the new Renaissance.  The staff are excited be there, and it shows in the service.  Anthony at the front door is a shining star.  His smile brightened every day. Monee from housekeeping kept our room spotless and was friendly and gracious.  Can’t wait for the rooftop to open.

title: Great stay
text:
Had a great stay with excellent service and gorgeous rooms. Tastefully designed, great staff, quiet rooms, solid service, perfect location.

Always nice coming back and leaving to an open door held by the always-attentive Anthony.

title: Brand New and Beautiful, perfect location
text:
Fantastic team, including Lucy and Mateo.  This hotel opened in Feb 2020 and is in the perfect location for my Flatiron Office visit.  Comfortable rooms, great coffee and yummy breakfast were topped off with an epic view of the city.  

Everyone on our team will now choose this location, when we visit the NYC office.

title: Kind Service
text:
Hotel was pretty good, Anthony the doorman was wonderful, attentive, and kind! 
It’s not perfectly stocked, and there were some technical difficulties with the phone not working and hall light out. The bed was comfy though!

title: The Best Service! Boutique Hotel Feels!
text: Everything from the details in the design and decor to the amazing staff, specifically the doormen, make this place special and made my trip feel more like a getaway than work. As I was leaving, I had already planned to write a glowing review based on my 5 nights stay; then, Mateo sealed the deal for me when he joined me outside in the rain with an umbrella and walked my large suitcase to my car after seeing me search for my driver who went halfway down the block and asked me to walk down to meet him. I will absolutely stay here again and again! This is my NYC hotel of choice, hands down!

title: Great Stay!
text:
I usually don't write reviews but I feel this hotel is worthy of one. My friends and I stayed at the Renaissance this past weekend and had an amazing stay! We were in town for a bachelorette party so needless to say, many girls, many opinions, and we were all so pleased with the hotel. From the staff to the ambiance, everything was wonderful. 

I will definitely be back this summer to check out the rooftop pool and bar!

title: Great visit
text: First time visiting this wonderful Hotel. Rooms are beautiful and all amenities are fantastic. Staff was wonderful and bent over backwards to accommodate all of our requests. If you're in Manhattan give it a try, one of our best stays while there

title: Nice Stay
text:
Just returned from a one night stay in NYC at the Renaissance Chelsea hotel. The staff was outstanding and attentive. Elizabeth at the front desk was SUPER!!
The room that I had requested was not ready when we arrived early in the day. We accepted a double room on the 15th floor. Room was fine; beds comfortable and all was good except for the lack of soundproofing between rooms. Normal volume conversations were easily heard from the next room. 
Overall the stay was fine. Would return again.

title: Terrific Stay
text: Probably one of the best hotels I have stayed at in a very long time. NYC is usually hit or miss for me on my business trips. This the first time I have stayed at this particular hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The bar was a great spot to relax with a cocktail after a long day. The bed was extremely comfortable. This might be a weird comment, but the water pressure in the shower was phenomenal. That is a rarity. Overall, great stay!

title: Amazing Property in a Great Location
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights and this is a gorgeous new property. The staff seemed green but they were eager to assist.  The design is very unique and feels very comfortable.  Nice hidden ornate objects around to discover.  
I will be back!

title: Great Location! Great Staff! Great Room! Great Views!
text: My husband and I decided to take a last minute trip to NYC in February to celebrate our anniversary. We were amazed by everything at this hotel. The location was fantastic - close to anything and everything you need in NYC. The staff was fantastic. The front desk staff were gracious and helpful. When they found out about our anniversary, they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and a charcuterie tray.  I met the general manager, Chris, who was interacting with all the guests in the lobby. He was making making sure everyone was happy with their stay. The rooms were super clean and the views took my breath away. I can't say more about this hotel. I highly recommend.

title: Disapointed
text: Great location (24-hr CVS snd Starbucks within 2 minutes) and friendly staff, but so, so disappointed!! Rooms were small but well designed, good bathrooms and comfy bed. BUT: Lack of amenities in room, tiny closet, no bottled water or bar fridge, tiny towels, no hairdryer. Found a pair of used men's underwear in closet (see pic), complained about it and they were still there the next day...AND my room was really poorly serviced. They have a nice looking restaurant which is only open for breakfast, which makes no sense, and means there's no room service. Could do much, MUCH better.

title: Very Disappointing
text:
I visited this hotel last month with anticipation and left regretting that I spent my money here.

First, the check-in process -- when I checked in, I asked if there were any upgrades (I'm a titanium elite), and was told that I was already upgraded to a city view king.  When I  informed the receptionist that's the room that I booked, I was told that there were no upgrades available.  After getting to our room, I checked the Marriott app and saw that there were at least 1 corner room available (for $30 more than my booked room).  I called the front desk, and the receptionist then went to presumably speak with her manager and came back to tell me that I can have that room for $100/night more.  I suggested that this was  not the usual response I get from  other Marriott properties and was told that the manager would call me back in about 20 minutes.  The manager never called.

Next the room.  The rooms looked good in photos but in reality, it were much smaller than expected and looked rather cheap with faux tiles and cheap furnishings.  The closet is also tiny and pretty much useless for anything more than a couple of coats.  In addition, there was no safe in the room and we had no real view.

SUMMARY
Don't stay here.  While the hotel is in a good location and has a cool lobby, it isn't enough to justify a stay there.  There are a lot of Marriott properties in Manhattan and a many are better value and treat elites much better.

title: so many teething problems to sort out before it becomes a great place!
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 8 days in February. The desk staff here were absolutely fantastic, so helpful, friendly and professional - which is what makes it so hard to write this review...

This hotel has the potential to be amazing, but at the moment there is a lot of stuff to sort out, so here's a brief list.
The very small safe (that wouldn't fit my small laptop) in the room didn't work.
Housekeeping staff came in on 2 seperate days when I had the do not disturb sign on. They also kept supplying only decaf for the in room coffee machine (annoying because I dont drink decaf).
Room phone stopped working mid-stay.
A/C stopped working mid-stay and would only blow hot.
Not much room to keep suitcase in the room.
Not much room in the closet for hanging shirts and clothes.
No fridge in room.
Ice machine only in the basement.
Gym very small and not well equipped - a/c in here does not blow cold enough.
Wi-fi only free for marriott members, although advertised on expedia as free.

Positives about my stay:
Desk staff - Can't praise them enough, great people.
Wi-fi speed great.
Design and decor throughout the hotel is cool.

I just MAY stay here again, but only if they get things right!

title: Was hoping for similar to renaissance midtown but not close
text:
