Staff is very friendly and welcoming.  Rooms are small even for nyc standards.  I was disappointed at room not particularly clean, spots on sheet, and noise from other rooms and hall is surprisingly bad.  

The building itself is nice, but, very surprising issues for a hotel that is so new and purpose built.  

And on top the 25.00 mandatory amenity charge is absurd.  Offensive really.  

Much better options all available all around.

title: New hotel - will be nice but needs a few tweaks - great staff
text:
The hotel is beautiful - just needs a few tweaks. I think they opened a bit early. Plumbing/air/heat issues...but all were fixed by the awesome, friendly and reliable overnight engineer, JAMES. 

Also really enjoyed how helpful and humble some of the other staff were, like the bellman ANTHONY. He greeted me every time he saw me enter or exit the hotel for 10 days and always insisted on helping even when I told him I had no cash to tip. I appreciated that. 

The area doesn’t have many other clean, affordable and convenient hotels. This new addition is certainly welcome. 

Will stay again!

title: Beautiful new hotel in great location with excellent staff
text: This hotel is a winner.  It is very well located and only a couple of blocks from a subway that leads downtown and to Brooklyn.  The rooms are beautifully decorated.  The beds are comfortable, the TV's large and the showers are roomy and ample in terms of water pressure.  I can't say enough about the staff.  I requested an early check in by phone from the airport and the room was waiting for me when I arrived.  Also, I never opened a door during my three days there.  The staff was friendly and always present.   The only (minor and somewhat entertaining) issue is the sound insulation.  On our last night there, we were able to clearly hear the conversation of the couple next door.  The conversation led to -- shall we say -- "more intimate" activities, which were also quite audible.  After a short time, those activities -- shall we say -- "concluded" and we were able to enjoy a restful and comfortable night.

title: Thank you ANDREW and CHRIS
text:
It's always great to stay at a new hotel but there are still kinks to be worked out.  Being a Platinum member, I was surprised that I could not check-in (even after doing the mobile check-in and having it confirmed) when I arrived at 12.  Even when I offered to wait, I was told nothing was available until 3:30.  There were several of us in the same boat.   The first time in over 50 stays at least.   Also, when I was able to check in and waited for my stored luggage which was clearly stored somewhere far, far away, I observed all four front desk chatting with a guest about his trip to Barbados when clearly there was another guest waiting and getting increasingly irritated.  I like their enthusiasm and personal attention, but there needs to be more training and efficiency.  My check-in process took over 5 minutes, which is long for a check-in process.

The outstanding part were the guys out front standing in the cold--a huge shout out to Andrew and Chris.  They provided phenomenal service.  From the moment Andrew patiently waited for me to exit the taxi, which took about ten minutes because of a payment snafu, to their efficiency and professionalism, I was impressed.  Believe me, usually, I'm in a rush in and out so don't notice these things.  And, anytime I tipped, they were appreciative--other hotels, especially in NYC, they feel it's their due.  Whoever is in charge for the bellhop/valet.

Love the funky/quirky style fo this hotel.  The rooms are nice but super small.  Also, there is a design flaw in the bathroom sink.   The custom cement/concrete sink is smaller than average with a shelf above it.  When I lean over the sink, somehow my face is over the ledge with the faucet underneath the ledge.  If I move back a step to wash my face, spit, etc., I'm not fully over the sink.   A small thing that only started bugging when the floor had some water and the towels underneath got a a little wet.

title: Great New Hotel, Great Location
text: Stayed here over Valentine's weekend for 2 nights.  Reached out to Gen Mgr Chris beforehand and received a nice welcome email.  Was able to meet Chris upon check-in and he followed up late with an email - above and beyond.  Front desk staff very friendly and polite as were the doorman (like a 5 star hotel).  I was put in a high floor King corner room, which has amazing 180 views from Hudson Yards to Madison Sq Park and Empire State bldg.  Room is cozy but good for NYC standards, bed was very nice, very quiet - no street noise, or other rooms, well layed out and nice shower, and A/C worked perfect.  No complaints and would definitely stay here again!  I'm a lifetime titanium bonvoy member and have stayed in many Marriott properties across the country and world.  Very impressed with service and rooms, especially given it was only open 6 days when I arrived!

title: BEWARE of EXTRA CHARGES even months before your stay!
text:
I made a reservation for June, and they suddenly charged over 300 USD from my credit card on Feb 22 for no reason. I was supposed to pay everything at the property. 
Frustrating to say at least, I have now been contacting them and just hoping they will solve this quickly and refund my money asap!

title: BEST HOTEL IN CHELSEA
text:
Stayed here with my wife the day after Valentine’s Day. This hotel is brand new.  Despite the fact they’re only open for a week or two and have some minor issues to iron out, this hotel was very accommodating and the staff was hands down very polite, patient and helpful in every way. The manager Chris has everything under control! Very nice gentleman. This will be my goto hotel every time I’m in NYC. 

One more thing. Johny’s Luncheonette is right next door for a great breakfast or quick lunch!!

title: Great Stay. Wonderful Staff.
text: My wife and I were in the city for our anniversary. I had prepaid for the hotel months ago, and became a little nervous when I read the reviews for the newly opened hotel. Everything was perfect the entire weekend. The doormen were extremely friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze, breakfast was great. Room was gorgeous. This will definitely be our go to hotel in the city moving forward.

title: Great new hotel
text: A boutique style Renaissance that has been open only two weeks.  I love the decor.  The front of house staff is amazing.  Anthony the bellman welcomed me everyday and called my cab for me.  He mentioned they will have a pool and rooftop dining in time for warm weather.  They are still in process of opening restaurant/room service so plan on eating somewhere in the area for now. Plenty of options to walk to nearby.

title: Do not stay here
text: I am here now and it is a HORRIBLE experience. Arrived late Monday night to room that was 80 degrees. Temp wouldn’t go down past 78 degrees. Complained at 8:30 am Tuesday morning. Told there was an issue in some rooms but it would be fixed. Arrived back at hotel at 11pm Tuesday. Not fixed. Told all rooms in whole hotel had issues and there was nothing they could do except crack a window.  It even a bottle of water in the room. Just a really bad experience. No choice but to sweat it out at this point as it’s now past 11.

title: New hotel with thin walls
text: The hotel is new and fancy, but the walls are very thin and it was hard to sleep. You could hear people in other rooms very easily. Many of the amenities weren't ready yet since the hotel is brand new. I would not stay here again.

title: Beautiful new property in Chelsea!
text:
First of all, greeted by the two nicest bellmen ever, Anthony and Matteo. They were there pretty much (along with other great ones) my entire stay. Never had to touch a door and always pleasant and smiling. Love these guys! 

The hotel itself is situated perfectly for where I work but anyone traveling to the city and wanting easy access to MSG, Penn Station, Times Square, Macy’s, Broadway, etc but wants to stay out of the tourist zone, this is a great hotel for you! Loved the proximity to restaurants and within walking distance to all the hot spots (3-4 blocks away). 

The interiors are beautifully laid out, very biophillic design with the leafy wallpaper, gorgeous rooms (though your typical NYC size) but I like the coziness. The bathroom is great with rainfall shower heads which I loved! Cool headboards btw and loved all the wood-like finishes! Of course everything is brand new (they had just opened) but there were no kinks to be worked out. The staff was on their game and extremely nice and helpful! 

I did not try out the restaurant or bar at night but the breakfast was nice. 

This will be my “go to” hotel in NYC from this point forward. Looking forward to many more great stays!

title: Great Location, Ambiance and Staff
text:
I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions since it opened and, as someone who has stayed in multiple locations/properties throughout the City, this one stands out.  During my first stay, I had the pleasure of meeting Issac (front desk) and Lenny (door), both of whom were extremely welcoming and made the stay very pleasurable.  I appreciate the fact that they make the effort to connect with the guests.  I was there this week again and had the pleasure of meeting Mateo and Anthony, who equally were welcoming and extremely helpful.  

Additionally, the rooms are well appointed and the gym (which has Peloton bike and plenty of dumbbells), is spacious, clean and a great space to work out in.  

While there have been some minor glitches with the hotel (testing of fire alarm mid-day), they are to be expected given its recent opening.  When those glitches have arisen, the staff have been extremely responsive and apologetic.  I have stayed at more established hotels in the City, which have not been as gracious or accommodating when similar issues have arisen. 

I am booked to stay at this hotel again next month and plan to make it my go-to in the City.

title: Disappointing stay
text:
Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. .... atleast for now. The hotel is not ready . We had to change rooms twice because of the noise. Banging first ... then what sounded like bandsaw possibly from the roof ? On top of that we never got a good nights rest because the fire alarm went off EVERY MORNING around 9am. We are the types that like to stay out late and sleep in late . Its a VACATION . I couldnt wait to get out of there and go back home . I had some clothing i left in one of the rooms while we were moving ...they said they found but for some reason it took 2 days to get it finally returned to me although i was told numerous times that it was being sent up any minute .
The people at the front desk and door and very nice and i liked the location of the hotel. Its obvious the hotel was just not ready to open , which is not their fault, but i really wished we would have stayed down a couple blocks at the eventi where we usually do . Pretty upset that marriott opened a hotel to guests when they were clearly not ready for business

title: OK, not great
text: Room was decorated nicely and it’s a good location.  Need to work on the breakfast buffet, have cold cereal, oatmeal, etc.  We had to get engineering up to our room to close the window which was open, night light broke for a bit.  Gym was too hot and no cold water there.  Got an upgraded room, but it was still pretty small.

title: Not ready yet
text:
We stayed at the new Renaissance Chelsea this past weekend.  It has only been open a week, and so we expected some glitches.  And there were many.  We checked in at 6 pm and they had trouble finding a clean room for us.  We were given a room, but not the room we booked (a king corner).  The room we checked in to at first was tiny.  So we asked to move, and that was not an easy process.  At first we were told we could move and so we packed up, only to get a call 5 minutes later to say that no king corner rooms were available after all.  We did stop by the front desk on our way out and they found a room and said they move our bags while we’re out at dinner.  That never happened and when we came back the new person at the front desk had no info on our move request and said it was not possible as all the king corner rooms were booked.  They did move us the next day but our new room had no hot water, which eventually got fixed but that was not pleasant.  We also had to call down and request  bath products as there were none in the room.  The biggest complaint we had was all the waiting, the line to get our new room key was over 30 minutes long, and then we had to wait 25 minutes in a London no elevator line, and that caused us to miss our dinner reservation.  It was complete chaos.

On the plus side - The staff was very pleasant.  The hotel looks nice.  It is not at alll ready for guests and it was a very challenging stay.

title: Great Stay
text: Staff were very helpful and polite.  Provided plenty of complimentary coffee and water.  Room was comfortable. Housekeeping did not even change sheets once, even though they had coffee stains. Good location and great-view, as we walked around much of Manhattan

title: Nice hotel not without its flaws
text:
I enjoyed my two night stay at the Renaissance Chelsea and will likely give it another try on future trips. The lobby, hallways, and rooms are interestingly designed, no cookie cutter was used here.  But there is some room for improvement.

My room was thoughtfully laid out and quirkily decorated, with a number of rabbit and plant themed accoutrements that apparently harken back to the property’s former life as a flea market or something.  My room, a corner king, was small but highly functional, perfect for a solo business trip.  Everything is brand new since the property was built from the ground up and opened four days before I arrived, and everything worked perfectly (including the bunny shaped light and coffee maker (Starbucks provided); there is no fridge).  The bedding was comfortable and the towels were awesome. Not a ton of storage - the closet area was literally about 16 inches wide and held the ironing board, so clothes horses might have some troubles.  But the three cute bunny hooks on the wall can hold a coat and other things, and really I had no issues at all with the amount of storage space.  The walls were a bunch of different textures and designs but they worked well together and all in all the bedroom is very nice to look at.  There was a cozy chair in the corner, a couple of handy little trays for your pocket stuff, and both sides of the bed had two nesting tables, more great details. Lots of places to plug things in and lights everywhere you need them.  Wifi was fine.  Housekeeping sadly took my little shampoo bottles and bar of soap after the first night - incredibly wasteful but probably a training issue.

The bathroom again was on the smaller side but was perfectly fine.  In fact the rainfall shower (no tub - yay!) was one of the best hotel showers I’ve ever experienced.  And the concrete sink and cool etched mirror with nightlight feature were also nice touches.  The framed picture in the bathroom also matched the framing of the bathroom door.  Nicely done!

Service was good, and I almost never had to touch a door handle thanks to the many doormen always eager to assist.  The elevators require a key tap before you can type in or tap a screen to choose your floor.  I never had to wait for an elevator but the card reader was very finicky.

Breakfast for Platinum guests was a definite lowlight and almost has to be a temporary solution.  The best I can describe the spread is “sad”.  It was brought in from some outside caterer on a cart and consisted of bins of scrambled eggs, potatoes, and bacon, a bowl of yogurt, a bowl of cut up fruit and some bread for toasting.  It was all laid out on the bar, separate from the dining room, and just looked and felt like an afterthought.  But at least it was offered and it filled me up fine, but I’ve had better breakfasts at a Fairfield Inn.  Even the coffee was brought in from the outside in urns, and my coffee was brought to me in a paper cup even though a nice mug was on my table.  I also had a bottle of beer one night at the bar - disappointed that it was $12 but that’s life in the big city.  “Room service” is handled by an outside company but the prices were very reasonable.  

The room I had on the 22nd floor featured great soundproof windows but alarmingly for a brand new hotel the soundproofing didn’t seem to extend to the walls. I could fairly clearly hear people coughing and having normal conversations in other rooms, though I never heard like a tv blaring or anything that kept me awake.  But I do wonder what it might have been like had I had bad neighbors.  

I should mention the basement gym is small but had maybe 4 treadmills, a spin cycle, a recumbent bike, and a couple of elliptical machines, along with some dumbbells and mats and things.  Pretty small but functional, and all brand new.  There was an odd filtered water machine that looked like a coffee maker - I’ve never seen a contraption like it before.

Overall I liked the new Renaissance and look forward to seeing the new rooftop pool and bar when they eventually open. But hopefully the walls are not as thin as they seemed and the breakfast situation sees some improvement.
